In Java, the final keyword is used to restrict the modification of variables, methods, and classes. There are 3 ways to input in the final keyword.. 3 ways to constext -:-->Final Variable-:A final variable cannot be reassigned after it has been initialized.For objects, final means the reference cannot change, but the object's contents can (unless the object itself is immutable).-->Final Method-:A final method cannot be overridden by subclasses.-->Final Class-:A final class cannot be extended (no subclassing).hashtag#Java hashtag#Coding hashtag#Learning hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment hashtag#Programming hashtag#TechJourney

Day:-8 Learning selenium with java (Automation)✅"Before diving into Selenium with Java, it's important to have a good understanding of Core Java topics."🌟 What is a Package?A package is like a folder in your computer that helps you organize your Java files (classes, interfaces, etc.).🌟 Why do we use Packages?To organize code neatlyTo avoid name conflicts (two classes can have the same name if they are in different packages)To reuse code easilyTo make project structure clean and easy to manage🌟 Types of Packages:Built-in packages – already available in Java (like java.util, java.io)User-defined packages – created by us to group our own classes🌟 How to Create and Use a Package?You create a package using the package keyword.You use it by importing it with the import keyword.🌟 Think of it like this:Your computer has folders (packages)Inside folders, you have files (Java classes)You can open and use files from any folder using the correct path (importing the package)

🔁 𝐌𝐞𝐭𝐡𝐨𝐝 𝐎𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐫𝐢𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠, 𝐃𝐲𝐧𝐚𝐦𝐢𝐜 𝐁𝐢𝐧𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠 & 𝐑𝐮𝐧𝐭𝐢𝐦𝐞 𝐏𝐨𝐥𝐲𝐦𝐨𝐫𝐩𝐡𝐢𝐬𝐦 — 𝐒𝐢𝐦𝐩𝐥𝐢𝐟𝐢𝐞𝐝!If you're working with inheritance in Java or automation frameworks like Selenium, this is one of the most powerful concepts👇🔁 𝐌𝐞𝐭𝐡𝐨𝐝 𝐎𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐫𝐢𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠 ✅ Definition: Redefining a method of the parent class in the child class🔹 Key Rules:1. Method signature must be exactly the same2. Return type must be the same or covariant3. Access modifier can be more permissive (not more restrictive)4. Happens only in inheritance5. Enables runtime polymorphism⚡ 𝐃𝐲𝐧𝐚𝐦𝐢𝐜 𝐁𝐢𝐧𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠 (𝐚.𝐤.𝐚 𝐋𝐚𝐭𝐞 𝐁𝐢𝐧𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠) ✅ The method to execute is decided at runtime 🔹 Used when:1. You're overriding methods2. Based on object type, not the reference type📌 | 𝐉𝐚𝐯𝐚 𝐝𝐞𝐭𝐞𝐫𝐦𝐢𝐧𝐞𝐬 𝐚𝐭 𝐫𝐮𝐧𝐭𝐢𝐦𝐞 𝐰𝐡𝐢𝐜𝐡 𝐨𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐫𝐢𝐝𝐝𝐞𝐧 𝐦𝐞𝐭𝐡𝐨𝐝 𝐭𝐨 𝐞𝐱𝐞𝐜𝐮𝐭𝐞 𝐛𝐚𝐬𝐞𝐝 𝐨𝐧 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐨𝐛𝐣𝐞𝐜𝐭 𝐭𝐲𝐩𝐞🛠️ 𝐑𝐮𝐧𝐭𝐢𝐦𝐞 𝐏𝐨𝐥𝐲𝐦𝐨𝐫𝐩𝐡𝐢𝐬𝐦 ✅ Occurs when a parent class reference is used to call an overridden method in the child class✅ Example: Run-Time Polymorphism (via Method Over-riding) java𝒄𝒍𝒂𝒔𝒔 𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 { 𝒗𝒐𝒊𝒅 𝒂𝒖𝒕𝒉𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒊𝒄𝒂𝒕𝒆() { 𝑺𝒚𝒔𝒕𝒆𝒎.𝒐𝒖𝒕.𝒑𝒓𝒊𝒏𝒕𝒍𝒏("𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 𝒂𝒔 𝑮𝒖𝒆𝒔𝒕"); }}𝒄𝒍𝒂𝒔𝒔 𝑨𝒅𝒎𝒊𝒏𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 𝒆𝒙𝒕𝒆𝒏𝒅𝒔 𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 { 𝒗𝒐𝒊𝒅 𝒂𝒖𝒕𝒉𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒊𝒄𝒂𝒕𝒆() { 𝑺𝒚𝒔𝒕𝒆𝒎.𝒐𝒖𝒕.𝒑𝒓𝒊𝒏𝒕𝒍𝒏("𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 𝒂𝒔 𝑨𝒅𝒎𝒊𝒏"); }}𝒑𝒖𝒃𝒍𝒊𝒄 𝒄𝒍𝒂𝒔𝒔 𝑻𝒆𝒔𝒕 { 𝒑𝒖𝒃𝒍𝒊𝒄 𝒔𝒕𝒂𝒕𝒊𝒄 𝒗𝒐𝒊𝒅 𝒎𝒂𝒊𝒏(𝑺𝒕𝒓𝒊𝒏𝒈[] 𝒂𝒓𝒈𝒔) { 𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 𝒐𝒃𝒋 = 𝒏𝒆𝒘 𝑨𝒅𝒎𝒊𝒏𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏(); // 👈 𝑹𝒆𝒇𝒆𝒓𝒆𝒏𝒄𝒆 𝒕𝒚𝒑𝒆: 𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 | 𝑶𝒃𝒋𝒆𝒄𝒕 𝒕𝒚𝒑𝒆:𝑨𝒅𝒎𝒊𝒏𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 𝒐𝒃𝒋.𝒂𝒖𝒕𝒉𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒊𝒄𝒂𝒕𝒆(); // 👈 𝑪𝒂𝒍𝒍𝒔 𝑨𝒅𝒎𝒊𝒏𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏’𝒔 𝒎𝒆𝒕𝒉𝒐𝒅 𝒂𝒕 𝒓𝒖𝒏𝒕𝒊𝒎𝒆(𝒅𝒚𝒏𝒂𝒎𝒊𝒄 𝒃𝒊𝒏𝒅𝒊𝒏𝒈) }}

HOW REMOTE WORK GIVES SMALL BUSINESSES A FIGHTING CHANCE In early 2020 as we contemplated or more like dreaded the idea of having the entire team working remotely, little did we know that remote work would be the silver lining we needed.Sure, we moved on from NGcareers in 2020 (after exiting to ROAM/Jobberman) but the lessons we got from working remotely in 2020 positioned us for our next venture.When we started Remote4Africa there was no question of whether to be a remote company or not. The very nature of Remote4Africa meant we had to live what we preached - full remote operation.SO HOW DOES WORKING REMOTELY FAVOUR THE SMALL GUY? As a small, medium or growing company remote work gives you several advantages. Forget the naysayers and come with me. The two biggest advantages;Bigger Talent Pool As a remote company you are not restricted to just one city in your search for talent to help grow the company. You can literally hire smart young people from across the entire country or even continent (We help companies hire remotely - https://lnkd.in/g5-2qm2p). Your talent pool becomes automatically wider. Greater Cost EfficiencyA startup or small business usually doesn’t have endless money, in fact most struggle financially in the early years until their products/services start to generate significant revenue to outpace expenses. So how do you keep yourself in the game and extend the chances of your business surviving? By keeping expenses as low as possible. Going remote does that for you. We spent millions annually in office rent in Lagos. That was money that could have gone into marketing or direct revenue impacting activity. If you are building/growing a business in any major African city you know office costs are a significant part of your expenses. Aside rent you are talking about utilities, furniture etc.You can take some of that saving and give your remote staff stuff like data allowances, workspace allowances etc to help them set up and work comfortably from home.If you run a company/business and thinking of going remote you can reach out and ask any questions. I’ll be glad to advise and share lessons from what we’ve learnt running a remote company for 5 years now.hashtag#hiringremote hashtag#remotecompanies hashtag#businesstips hashtag#recruitingtips

Day:-8 Learning selenium with java (Automation)✅"Before diving into Selenium with Java, it's important to have a good understanding of Core Java topics."🌟 What is Exception Handling?Exception handling is a way to manage errors that occur while a program is running. Instead of stopping the entire program when an error happens, exception handling lets you control what should happen when something goes wrong.🌟 Why is it important?It helps prevent the program from crashing.It allows the program to continue running even after an error.It shows clear and friendly error messages to the user.It makes debugging and fixing issues easier.🌟 How does it work?You write the code that might cause an error inside a special block. If an error happens, another block will handle it. This keeps the program safe and avoids unexpected crashes.🌟 Key Terms:Try: The block where you write the code that might cause an error.Catch: The block where you handle the error if it occurs.Finally: A block that runs no matter what—whether there was an error or not.Throw: Used to create custom errors or exceptions.Throws: Used to declare exceptions that a method might cause.

Today's Learning Journey 📕: Stacks in JavaToday, I explored one of the fundamental data structures— the Stack.**What is a Stack?** A Stack is a linear data structure that follows the LIFO (Last In, First Out) principle. The last element added is the first one to be removed. Think of it like a stack of plates — you add to the top and remove from the top.**Why It's Important?** Stacks are used in many areas like function calls, expression evaluation, undo features in editors, and more. Understanding how they work is essential for solving real-world problems and mastering algorithms.**Key Takeaways:** 1. Core Operations: push(), pop(), peek(), and isEmpty()2. Implementation: Explored Java's built-in Stack class and also implemented it manually using arrays and linked lists. 3. Applications: Helps build intuition for recursion, backtracking, and parsing tasks.hashtag#Java hashtag#DataStructures hashtag#Stack hashtag#CodingJourney hashtag#Programming hashtag#TechLearning

كلامنا النهاردة عن  JVM، JRE، وJDK... مين هم أبطال القصة؟في عالم جافا، عندنا 3 شخصيات رئيسية، وكل واحدة ليها دور مهم جدًا:يلا نغوص سوا في عالم JVM، JRE، وJDK ونفهم كل واحدة فيهم بتشتغل إزاي؟ 🧠 أولاً: JVM – Java Virtual Machine ده هو قلب القصة.تخيله كأنه "المترجم الذكي" اللي بياخد الـ Bytecode (ملفات .class) ويحوّله لحاجة الجهاز يفهمها وظيفته:يقرأ ملفات .class اللي بيطلّعها الـ Compilerيفسرها سطر بسطر ويحوّلها لـ Machine Codeيتعامل مع نظام التشغيل (Windows / Linux / macOS)بيشتغل على أي جهاز فيه JVM → عشان كده جافا بتشتغل في كل مكان!أنواعه: كل نظام تشغيل ليه JVM خاصة بيه. الكود بيشتغل على أي نظام بشرط يكون فيه JVM.🌱 ثانيًا: JRE – Java Runtime Environment📦 دي البيئة اللي بيعيش فيها برنامج جافا بعد ما تكتبه.بتتكوّن من:JVMJava Class Libraries (زي System.out, ArrayList, Scanner, …)وظيفتها: تشغّل برامج جافا الجاهزة، بس مش ينفع تكتبي أو ترجمي كود جديد بيها. مثال: لو عندك برنامج جاهز وعايزة تشغّليه → محتاجة JRE فقط.🔧 ثالثًا: JDK – Java Development Kitدي العُدّة الكاملة لأي مطوّر/مطوّرة جافا.بتحتوي على:✅ كل مكونات الـ JRE✅ أدوات التطوير (Dev Tools):javac: لتحويل الكود لـ Bytecodejava: لتشغيل البرامجjavadoc: لتوليد التوثيقDebuggers: لتتبع الأخطاءوظيفتها:كتابة الكودترجمتهتشغيلهاختباره يعني باختصار: لو هتشتغل على مشروع جافا → لازم تنزّل الـ JDK الـ JRE لوحده مش هيكفي.لو وصلت لحد هنا، شاركني: أنت كنت عارف الفرق بينهم قبل كده؟ ولا دي أول مرة الصورة توضح؟ 😊👇hashtag#Java hashtag#JVM hashtag#JRE hashtag#JDK hashtag#LearnJava hashtag#Backend hashtag#ProgrammingBasics hashtag#لينكدإن

In Java, the final keyword is used to restrict the modification of variables, methods, and classes. There are 3 ways to input in the final keyword.. 3 ways to constext -:-->Final Variable-:A final variable cannot be reassigned after it has been initialized.For objects, final means the reference cannot change, but the object's contents can (unless the object itself is immutable).-->Final Method-:A final method cannot be overridden by subclasses.-->Final Class-:A final class cannot be extended (no subclassing).hashtag#Java hashtag#Coding hashtag#Learning hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment hashtag#Programming hashtag#TechJourney

Day:-8 Learning selenium with java (Automation)✅"Before diving into Selenium with Java, it's important to have a good understanding of Core Java topics."🌟 What is a Package?A package is like a folder in your computer that helps you organize your Java files (classes, interfaces, etc.).🌟 Why do we use Packages?To organize code neatlyTo avoid name conflicts (two classes can have the same name if they are in different packages)To reuse code easilyTo make project structure clean and easy to manage🌟 Types of Packages:Built-in packages – already available in Java (like java.util, java.io)User-defined packages – created by us to group our own classes🌟 How to Create and Use a Package?You create a package using the package keyword.You use it by importing it with the import keyword.🌟 Think of it like this:Your computer has folders (packages)Inside folders, you have files (Java classes)You can open and use files from any folder using the correct path (importing the package)

🔁 𝐌𝐞𝐭𝐡𝐨𝐝 𝐎𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐫𝐢𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠, 𝐃𝐲𝐧𝐚𝐦𝐢𝐜 𝐁𝐢𝐧𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠 & 𝐑𝐮𝐧𝐭𝐢𝐦𝐞 𝐏𝐨𝐥𝐲𝐦𝐨𝐫𝐩𝐡𝐢𝐬𝐦 — 𝐒𝐢𝐦𝐩𝐥𝐢𝐟𝐢𝐞𝐝!If you're working with inheritance in Java or automation frameworks like Selenium, this is one of the most powerful concepts👇🔁 𝐌𝐞𝐭𝐡𝐨𝐝 𝐎𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐫𝐢𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠 ✅ Definition: Redefining a method of the parent class in the child class🔹 Key Rules:1. Method signature must be exactly the same2. Return type must be the same or covariant3. Access modifier can be more permissive (not more restrictive)4. Happens only in inheritance5. Enables runtime polymorphism⚡ 𝐃𝐲𝐧𝐚𝐦𝐢𝐜 𝐁𝐢𝐧𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠 (𝐚.𝐤.𝐚 𝐋𝐚𝐭𝐞 𝐁𝐢𝐧𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠) ✅ The method to execute is decided at runtime 🔹 Used when:1. You're overriding methods2. Based on object type, not the reference type📌 | 𝐉𝐚𝐯𝐚 𝐝𝐞𝐭𝐞𝐫𝐦𝐢𝐧𝐞𝐬 𝐚𝐭 𝐫𝐮𝐧𝐭𝐢𝐦𝐞 𝐰𝐡𝐢𝐜𝐡 𝐨𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐫𝐢𝐝𝐝𝐞𝐧 𝐦𝐞𝐭𝐡𝐨𝐝 𝐭𝐨 𝐞𝐱𝐞𝐜𝐮𝐭𝐞 𝐛𝐚𝐬𝐞𝐝 𝐨𝐧 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐨𝐛𝐣𝐞𝐜𝐭 𝐭𝐲𝐩𝐞🛠️ 𝐑𝐮𝐧𝐭𝐢𝐦𝐞 𝐏𝐨𝐥𝐲𝐦𝐨𝐫𝐩𝐡𝐢𝐬𝐦 ✅ Occurs when a parent class reference is used to call an overridden method in the child class✅ Example: Run-Time Polymorphism (via Method Over-riding) java𝒄𝒍𝒂𝒔𝒔 𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 { 𝒗𝒐𝒊𝒅 𝒂𝒖𝒕𝒉𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒊𝒄𝒂𝒕𝒆() { 𝑺𝒚𝒔𝒕𝒆𝒎.𝒐𝒖𝒕.𝒑𝒓𝒊𝒏𝒕𝒍𝒏("𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 𝒂𝒔 𝑮𝒖𝒆𝒔𝒕"); }}𝒄𝒍𝒂𝒔𝒔 𝑨𝒅𝒎𝒊𝒏𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 𝒆𝒙𝒕𝒆𝒏𝒅𝒔 𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 { 𝒗𝒐𝒊𝒅 𝒂𝒖𝒕𝒉𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒊𝒄𝒂𝒕𝒆() { 𝑺𝒚𝒔𝒕𝒆𝒎.𝒐𝒖𝒕.𝒑𝒓𝒊𝒏𝒕𝒍𝒏("𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 𝒂𝒔 𝑨𝒅𝒎𝒊𝒏"); }}𝒑𝒖𝒃𝒍𝒊𝒄 𝒄𝒍𝒂𝒔𝒔 𝑻𝒆𝒔𝒕 { 𝒑𝒖𝒃𝒍𝒊𝒄 𝒔𝒕𝒂𝒕𝒊𝒄 𝒗𝒐𝒊𝒅 𝒎𝒂𝒊𝒏(𝑺𝒕𝒓𝒊𝒏𝒈[] 𝒂𝒓𝒈𝒔) { 𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 𝒐𝒃𝒋 = 𝒏𝒆𝒘 𝑨𝒅𝒎𝒊𝒏𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏(); // 👈 𝑹𝒆𝒇𝒆𝒓𝒆𝒏𝒄𝒆 𝒕𝒚𝒑𝒆: 𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 | 𝑶𝒃𝒋𝒆𝒄𝒕 𝒕𝒚𝒑𝒆:𝑨𝒅𝒎𝒊𝒏𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 𝒐𝒃𝒋.𝒂𝒖𝒕𝒉𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒊𝒄𝒂𝒕𝒆(); // 👈 𝑪𝒂𝒍𝒍𝒔 𝑨𝒅𝒎𝒊𝒏𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏’𝒔 𝒎𝒆𝒕𝒉𝒐𝒅 𝒂𝒕 𝒓𝒖𝒏𝒕𝒊𝒎𝒆(𝒅𝒚𝒏𝒂𝒎𝒊𝒄 𝒃𝒊𝒏𝒅𝒊𝒏𝒈) }}

HOW REMOTE WORK GIVES SMALL BUSINESSES A FIGHTING CHANCE In early 2020 as we contemplated or more like dreaded the idea of having the entire team working remotely, little did we know that remote work would be the silver lining we needed.Sure, we moved on from NGcareers in 2020 (after exiting to ROAM/Jobberman) but the lessons we got from working remotely in 2020 positioned us for our next venture.When we started Remote4Africa there was no question of whether to be a remote company or not. The very nature of Remote4Africa meant we had to live what we preached - full remote operation.SO HOW DOES WORKING REMOTELY FAVOUR THE SMALL GUY? As a small, medium or growing company remote work gives you several advantages. Forget the naysayers and come with me. The two biggest advantages;Bigger Talent Pool As a remote company you are not restricted to just one city in your search for talent to help grow the company. You can literally hire smart young people from across the entire country or even continent (We help companies hire remotely - https://lnkd.in/g5-2qm2p). Your talent pool becomes automatically wider. Greater Cost EfficiencyA startup or small business usually doesn’t have endless money, in fact most struggle financially in the early years until their products/services start to generate significant revenue to outpace expenses. So how do you keep yourself in the game and extend the chances of your business surviving? By keeping expenses as low as possible. Going remote does that for you. We spent millions annually in office rent in Lagos. That was money that could have gone into marketing or direct revenue impacting activity. If you are building/growing a business in any major African city you know office costs are a significant part of your expenses. Aside rent you are talking about utilities, furniture etc.You can take some of that saving and give your remote staff stuff like data allowances, workspace allowances etc to help them set up and work comfortably from home.If you run a company/business and thinking of going remote you can reach out and ask any questions. I’ll be glad to advise and share lessons from what we’ve learnt running a remote company for 5 years now.hashtag#hiringremote hashtag#remotecompanies hashtag#businesstips hashtag#recruitingtips

Day:-8 Learning selenium with java (Automation)✅"Before diving into Selenium with Java, it's important to have a good understanding of Core Java topics."🌟 What is Exception Handling?Exception handling is a way to manage errors that occur while a program is running. Instead of stopping the entire program when an error happens, exception handling lets you control what should happen when something goes wrong.🌟 Why is it important?It helps prevent the program from crashing.It allows the program to continue running even after an error.It shows clear and friendly error messages to the user.It makes debugging and fixing issues easier.🌟 How does it work?You write the code that might cause an error inside a special block. If an error happens, another block will handle it. This keeps the program safe and avoids unexpected crashes.🌟 Key Terms:Try: The block where you write the code that might cause an error.Catch: The block where you handle the error if it occurs.Finally: A block that runs no matter what—whether there was an error or not.Throw: Used to create custom errors or exceptions.Throws: Used to declare exceptions that a method might cause.

Today's Learning Journey 📕: Stacks in JavaToday, I explored one of the fundamental data structures— the Stack.**What is a Stack?** A Stack is a linear data structure that follows the LIFO (Last In, First Out) principle. The last element added is the first one to be removed. Think of it like a stack of plates — you add to the top and remove from the top.**Why It's Important?** Stacks are used in many areas like function calls, expression evaluation, undo features in editors, and more. Understanding how they work is essential for solving real-world problems and mastering algorithms.**Key Takeaways:** 1. Core Operations: push(), pop(), peek(), and isEmpty()2. Implementation: Explored Java's built-in Stack class and also implemented it manually using arrays and linked lists. 3. Applications: Helps build intuition for recursion, backtracking, and parsing tasks.hashtag#Java hashtag#DataStructures hashtag#Stack hashtag#CodingJourney hashtag#Programming hashtag#TechLearning

كلامنا النهاردة عن  JVM، JRE، وJDK... مين هم أبطال القصة؟في عالم جافا، عندنا 3 شخصيات رئيسية، وكل واحدة ليها دور مهم جدًا:يلا نغوص سوا في عالم JVM، JRE، وJDK ونفهم كل واحدة فيهم بتشتغل إزاي؟ 🧠 أولاً: JVM – Java Virtual Machine ده هو قلب القصة.تخيله كأنه "المترجم الذكي" اللي بياخد الـ Bytecode (ملفات .class) ويحوّله لحاجة الجهاز يفهمها وظيفته:يقرأ ملفات .class اللي بيطلّعها الـ Compilerيفسرها سطر بسطر ويحوّلها لـ Machine Codeيتعامل مع نظام التشغيل (Windows / Linux / macOS)بيشتغل على أي جهاز فيه JVM → عشان كده جافا بتشتغل في كل مكان!أنواعه: كل نظام تشغيل ليه JVM خاصة بيه. الكود بيشتغل على أي نظام بشرط يكون فيه JVM.🌱 ثانيًا: JRE – Java Runtime Environment📦 دي البيئة اللي بيعيش فيها برنامج جافا بعد ما تكتبه.بتتكوّن من:JVMJava Class Libraries (زي System.out, ArrayList, Scanner, …)وظيفتها: تشغّل برامج جافا الجاهزة، بس مش ينفع تكتبي أو ترجمي كود جديد بيها. مثال: لو عندك برنامج جاهز وعايزة تشغّليه → محتاجة JRE فقط.🔧 ثالثًا: JDK – Java Development Kitدي العُدّة الكاملة لأي مطوّر/مطوّرة جافا.بتحتوي على:✅ كل مكونات الـ JRE✅ أدوات التطوير (Dev Tools):javac: لتحويل الكود لـ Bytecodejava: لتشغيل البرامجjavadoc: لتوليد التوثيقDebuggers: لتتبع الأخطاءوظيفتها:كتابة الكودترجمتهتشغيلهاختباره يعني باختصار: لو هتشتغل على مشروع جافا → لازم تنزّل الـ JDK الـ JRE لوحده مش هيكفي.لو وصلت لحد هنا، شاركني: أنت كنت عارف الفرق بينهم قبل كده؟ ولا دي أول مرة الصورة توضح؟ 😊👇hashtag#Java hashtag#JVM hashtag#JRE hashtag#JDK hashtag#LearnJava hashtag#Backend hashtag#ProgrammingBasics hashtag#لينكدإن

🚀 My Java Journey: From Basics to Building Real-World Applications ☕✨✨✨Day 40🌄🌄Using of Final Keyword.... In Java, the final keyword is used to restrict the modification of variables, methods, and classes. There are 3 ways to input in the final keyword.. 3 ways to constext -:-->Final Variable-:A final variable cannot be reassigned after it has been initialized.For objects, final means the reference cannot change, but the object's contents can (unless the object itself is immutable).-->Final Method-:A final method cannot be overridden by subclasses.-->Final Class-:A final class cannot be extended (no subclassing).hashtag#Java hashtag#Coding hashtag#Learning hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment hashtag#Programming hashtag#TechJourney

Day:-8 Learning selenium with java (Automation)✅"Before diving into Selenium with Java, it's important to have a good understanding of Core Java topics."🌟 What is a Package?A package is like a folder in your computer that helps you organize your Java files (classes, interfaces, etc.).🌟 Why do we use Packages?To organize code neatlyTo avoid name conflicts (two classes can have the same name if they are in different packages)To reuse code easilyTo make project structure clean and easy to manage🌟 Types of Packages:Built-in packages – already available in Java (like java.util, java.io)User-defined packages – created by us to group our own classes🌟 How to Create and Use a Package?You create a package using the package keyword.You use it by importing it with the import keyword.🌟 Think of it like this:Your computer has folders (packages)Inside folders, you have files (Java classes)You can open and use files from any folder using the correct path (importing the package)

🔁 𝐌𝐞𝐭𝐡𝐨𝐝 𝐎𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐫𝐢𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠, 𝐃𝐲𝐧𝐚𝐦𝐢𝐜 𝐁𝐢𝐧𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠 & 𝐑𝐮𝐧𝐭𝐢𝐦𝐞 𝐏𝐨𝐥𝐲𝐦𝐨𝐫𝐩𝐡𝐢𝐬𝐦 — 𝐒𝐢𝐦𝐩𝐥𝐢𝐟𝐢𝐞𝐝!If you're working with inheritance in Java or automation frameworks like Selenium, this is one of the most powerful concepts👇🔁 𝐌𝐞𝐭𝐡𝐨𝐝 𝐎𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐫𝐢𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠 ✅ Definition: Redefining a method of the parent class in the child class🔹 Key Rules:1. Method signature must be exactly the same2. Return type must be the same or covariant3. Access modifier can be more permissive (not more restrictive)4. Happens only in inheritance5. Enables runtime polymorphism⚡ 𝐃𝐲𝐧𝐚𝐦𝐢𝐜 𝐁𝐢𝐧𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠 (𝐚.𝐤.𝐚 𝐋𝐚𝐭𝐞 𝐁𝐢𝐧𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠) ✅ The method to execute is decided at runtime 🔹 Used when:1. You're overriding methods2. Based on object type, not the reference type📌 | 𝐉𝐚𝐯𝐚 𝐝𝐞𝐭𝐞𝐫𝐦𝐢𝐧𝐞𝐬 𝐚𝐭 𝐫𝐮𝐧𝐭𝐢𝐦𝐞 𝐰𝐡𝐢𝐜𝐡 𝐨𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐫𝐢𝐝𝐝𝐞𝐧 𝐦𝐞𝐭𝐡𝐨𝐝 𝐭𝐨 𝐞𝐱𝐞𝐜𝐮𝐭𝐞 𝐛𝐚𝐬𝐞𝐝 𝐨𝐧 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐨𝐛𝐣𝐞𝐜𝐭 𝐭𝐲𝐩𝐞🛠️ 𝐑𝐮𝐧𝐭𝐢𝐦𝐞 𝐏𝐨𝐥𝐲𝐦𝐨𝐫𝐩𝐡𝐢𝐬𝐦 ✅ Occurs when a parent class reference is used to call an overridden method in the child class✅ Example: Run-Time Polymorphism (via Method Over-riding) java𝒄𝒍𝒂𝒔𝒔 𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 { 𝒗𝒐𝒊𝒅 𝒂𝒖𝒕𝒉𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒊𝒄𝒂𝒕𝒆() { 𝑺𝒚𝒔𝒕𝒆𝒎.𝒐𝒖𝒕.𝒑𝒓𝒊𝒏𝒕𝒍𝒏("𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 𝒂𝒔 𝑮𝒖𝒆𝒔𝒕"); }}𝒄𝒍𝒂𝒔𝒔 𝑨𝒅𝒎𝒊𝒏𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 𝒆𝒙𝒕𝒆𝒏𝒅𝒔 𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 { 𝒗𝒐𝒊𝒅 𝒂𝒖𝒕𝒉𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒊𝒄𝒂𝒕𝒆() { 𝑺𝒚𝒔𝒕𝒆𝒎.𝒐𝒖𝒕.𝒑𝒓𝒊𝒏𝒕𝒍𝒏("𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 𝒂𝒔 𝑨𝒅𝒎𝒊𝒏"); }}𝒑𝒖𝒃𝒍𝒊𝒄 𝒄𝒍𝒂𝒔𝒔 𝑻𝒆𝒔𝒕 { 𝒑𝒖𝒃𝒍𝒊𝒄 𝒔𝒕𝒂𝒕𝒊𝒄 𝒗𝒐𝒊𝒅 𝒎𝒂𝒊𝒏(𝑺𝒕𝒓𝒊𝒏𝒈[] 𝒂𝒓𝒈𝒔) { 𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 𝒐𝒃𝒋 = 𝒏𝒆𝒘 𝑨𝒅𝒎𝒊𝒏𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏(); // 👈 𝑹𝒆𝒇𝒆𝒓𝒆𝒏𝒄𝒆 𝒕𝒚𝒑𝒆: 𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 | 𝑶𝒃𝒋𝒆𝒄𝒕 𝒕𝒚𝒑𝒆:𝑨𝒅𝒎𝒊𝒏𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 𝒐𝒃𝒋.𝒂𝒖𝒕𝒉𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒊𝒄𝒂𝒕𝒆(); // 👈 𝑪𝒂𝒍𝒍𝒔 𝑨𝒅𝒎𝒊𝒏𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏’𝒔 𝒎𝒆𝒕𝒉𝒐𝒅 𝒂𝒕 𝒓𝒖𝒏𝒕𝒊𝒎𝒆(𝒅𝒚𝒏𝒂𝒎𝒊𝒄 𝒃𝒊𝒏𝒅𝒊𝒏𝒈) }}

HOW REMOTE WORK GIVES SMALL BUSINESSES A FIGHTING CHANCE In early 2020 as we contemplated or more like dreaded the idea of having the entire team working remotely, little did we know that remote work would be the silver lining we needed.Sure, we moved on from NGcareers in 2020 (after exiting to ROAM/Jobberman) but the lessons we got from working remotely in 2020 positioned us for our next venture.When we started Remote4Africa there was no question of whether to be a remote company or not. The very nature of Remote4Africa meant we had to live what we preached - full remote operation.SO HOW DOES WORKING REMOTELY FAVOUR THE SMALL GUY? As a small, medium or growing company remote work gives you several advantages. Forget the naysayers and come with me. The two biggest advantages;Bigger Talent Pool As a remote company you are not restricted to just one city in your search for talent to help grow the company. You can literally hire smart young people from across the entire country or even continent (We help companies hire remotely - https://lnkd.in/g5-2qm2p). Your talent pool becomes automatically wider. Greater Cost EfficiencyA startup or small business usually doesn’t have endless money, in fact most struggle financially in the early years until their products/services start to generate significant revenue to outpace expenses. So how do you keep yourself in the game and extend the chances of your business surviving? By keeping expenses as low as possible. Going remote does that for you. We spent millions annually in office rent in Lagos. That was money that could have gone into marketing or direct revenue impacting activity. If you are building/growing a business in any major African city you know office costs are a significant part of your expenses. Aside rent you are talking about utilities, furniture etc.You can take some of that saving and give your remote staff stuff like data allowances, workspace allowances etc to help them set up and work comfortably from home.If you run a company/business and thinking of going remote you can reach out and ask any questions. I’ll be glad to advise and share lessons from what we’ve learnt running a remote company for 5 years now.hashtag#hiringremote hashtag#remotecompanies hashtag#businesstips hashtag#recruitingtips

Day:-8 Learning selenium with java (Automation)✅"Before diving into Selenium with Java, it's important to have a good understanding of Core Java topics."🌟 What is Exception Handling?Exception handling is a way to manage errors that occur while a program is running. Instead of stopping the entire program when an error happens, exception handling lets you control what should happen when something goes wrong.🌟 Why is it important?It helps prevent the program from crashing.It allows the program to continue running even after an error.It shows clear and friendly error messages to the user.It makes debugging and fixing issues easier.🌟 How does it work?You write the code that might cause an error inside a special block. If an error happens, another block will handle it. This keeps the program safe and avoids unexpected crashes.🌟 Key Terms:Try: The block where you write the code that might cause an error.Catch: The block where you handle the error if it occurs.Finally: A block that runs no matter what—whether there was an error or not.Throw: Used to create custom errors or exceptions.Throws: Used to declare exceptions that a method might cause.

Today's Learning Journey 📕: Stacks in JavaToday, I explored one of the fundamental data structures— the Stack.**What is a Stack?** A Stack is a linear data structure that follows the LIFO (Last In, First Out) principle. The last element added is the first one to be removed. Think of it like a stack of plates — you add to the top and remove from the top.**Why It's Important?** Stacks are used in many areas like function calls, expression evaluation, undo features in editors, and more. Understanding how they work is essential for solving real-world problems and mastering algorithms.**Key Takeaways:** 1. Core Operations: push(), pop(), peek(), and isEmpty()2. Implementation: Explored Java's built-in Stack class and also implemented it manually using arrays and linked lists. 3. Applications: Helps build intuition for recursion, backtracking, and parsing tasks.hashtag#Java hashtag#DataStructures hashtag#Stack hashtag#CodingJourney hashtag#Programming hashtag#TechLearning

كلامنا النهاردة عن  JVM، JRE، وJDK... مين هم أبطال القصة؟في عالم جافا، عندنا 3 شخصيات رئيسية، وكل واحدة ليها دور مهم جدًا:يلا نغوص سوا في عالم JVM، JRE، وJDK ونفهم كل واحدة فيهم بتشتغل إزاي؟ 🧠 أولاً: JVM – Java Virtual Machine ده هو قلب القصة.تخيله كأنه "المترجم الذكي" اللي بياخد الـ Bytecode (ملفات .class) ويحوّله لحاجة الجهاز يفهمها وظيفته:يقرأ ملفات .class اللي بيطلّعها الـ Compilerيفسرها سطر بسطر ويحوّلها لـ Machine Codeيتعامل مع نظام التشغيل (Windows / Linux / macOS)بيشتغل على أي جهاز فيه JVM → عشان كده جافا بتشتغل في كل مكان!أنواعه: كل نظام تشغيل ليه JVM خاصة بيه. الكود بيشتغل على أي نظام بشرط يكون فيه JVM.🌱 ثانيًا: JRE – Java Runtime Environment📦 دي البيئة اللي بيعيش فيها برنامج جافا بعد ما تكتبه.بتتكوّن من:JVMJava Class Libraries (زي System.out, ArrayList, Scanner, …)وظيفتها: تشغّل برامج جافا الجاهزة، بس مش ينفع تكتبي أو ترجمي كود جديد بيها. مثال: لو عندك برنامج جاهز وعايزة تشغّليه → محتاجة JRE فقط.🔧 ثالثًا: JDK – Java Development Kitدي العُدّة الكاملة لأي مطوّر/مطوّرة جافا.بتحتوي على:✅ كل مكونات الـ JRE✅ أدوات التطوير (Dev Tools):javac: لتحويل الكود لـ Bytecodejava: لتشغيل البرامجjavadoc: لتوليد التوثيقDebuggers: لتتبع الأخطاءوظيفتها:كتابة الكودترجمتهتشغيلهاختباره يعني باختصار: لو هتشتغل على مشروع جافا → لازم تنزّل الـ JDK الـ JRE لوحده مش هيكفي.لو وصلت لحد هنا، شاركني: أنت كنت عارف الفرق بينهم قبل كده؟ ولا دي أول مرة الصورة توضح؟ 😊👇hashtag#Java hashtag#JVM hashtag#JRE hashtag#JDK hashtag#LearnJava hashtag#Backend hashtag#ProgrammingBasics hashtag#لينكدإن

In Java, the final keyword is used to restrict the modification of variables, methods, and classes. There are 3 ways to input in the final keyword.. 3 ways to constext -:-->Final Variable-:A final variable cannot be reassigned after it has been initialized.For objects, final means the reference cannot change, but the object's contents can (unless the object itself is immutable).-->Final Method-:A final method cannot be overridden by subclasses.-->Final Class-:A final class cannot be extended (no subclassing).hashtag#Java hashtag#Coding hashtag#Learning hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment hashtag#Programming hashtag#TechJourney

Day:-8 Learning selenium with java (Automation)✅"Before diving into Selenium with Java, it's important to have a good understanding of Core Java topics."🌟 What is a Package?A package is like a folder in your computer that helps you organize your Java files (classes, interfaces, etc.).🌟 Why do we use Packages?To organize code neatlyTo avoid name conflicts (two classes can have the same name if they are in different packages)To reuse code easilyTo make project structure clean and easy to manage🌟 Types of Packages:Built-in packages – already available in Java (like java.util, java.io)User-defined packages – created by us to group our own classes🌟 How to Create and Use a Package?You create a package using the package keyword.You use it by importing it with the import keyword.🌟 Think of it like this:Your computer has folders (packages)Inside folders, you have files (Java classes)You can open and use files from any folder using the correct path (importing the package)

🔁 𝐌𝐞𝐭𝐡𝐨𝐝 𝐎𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐫𝐢𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠, 𝐃𝐲𝐧𝐚𝐦𝐢𝐜 𝐁𝐢𝐧𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠 & 𝐑𝐮𝐧𝐭𝐢𝐦𝐞 𝐏𝐨𝐥𝐲𝐦𝐨𝐫𝐩𝐡𝐢𝐬𝐦 — 𝐒𝐢𝐦𝐩𝐥𝐢𝐟𝐢𝐞𝐝!If you're working with inheritance in Java or automation frameworks like Selenium, this is one of the most powerful concepts👇🔁 𝐌𝐞𝐭𝐡𝐨𝐝 𝐎𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐫𝐢𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠 ✅ Definition: Redefining a method of the parent class in the child class🔹 Key Rules:1. Method signature must be exactly the same2. Return type must be the same or covariant3. Access modifier can be more permissive (not more restrictive)4. Happens only in inheritance5. Enables runtime polymorphism⚡ 𝐃𝐲𝐧𝐚𝐦𝐢𝐜 𝐁𝐢𝐧𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠 (𝐚.𝐤.𝐚 𝐋𝐚𝐭𝐞 𝐁𝐢𝐧𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠) ✅ The method to execute is decided at runtime 🔹 Used when:1. You're overriding methods2. Based on object type, not the reference type📌 | 𝐉𝐚𝐯𝐚 𝐝𝐞𝐭𝐞𝐫𝐦𝐢𝐧𝐞𝐬 𝐚𝐭 𝐫𝐮𝐧𝐭𝐢𝐦𝐞 𝐰𝐡𝐢𝐜𝐡 𝐨𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐫𝐢𝐝𝐝𝐞𝐧 𝐦𝐞𝐭𝐡𝐨𝐝 𝐭𝐨 𝐞𝐱𝐞𝐜𝐮𝐭𝐞 𝐛𝐚𝐬𝐞𝐝 𝐨𝐧 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐨𝐛𝐣𝐞𝐜𝐭 𝐭𝐲𝐩𝐞🛠️ 𝐑𝐮𝐧𝐭𝐢𝐦𝐞 𝐏𝐨𝐥𝐲𝐦𝐨𝐫𝐩𝐡𝐢𝐬𝐦 ✅ Occurs when a parent class reference is used to call an overridden method in the child class✅ Example: Run-Time Polymorphism (via Method Over-riding) java𝒄𝒍𝒂𝒔𝒔 𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 { 𝒗𝒐𝒊𝒅 𝒂𝒖𝒕𝒉𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒊𝒄𝒂𝒕𝒆() { 𝑺𝒚𝒔𝒕𝒆𝒎.𝒐𝒖𝒕.𝒑𝒓𝒊𝒏𝒕𝒍𝒏("𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 𝒂𝒔 𝑮𝒖𝒆𝒔𝒕"); }}𝒄𝒍𝒂𝒔𝒔 𝑨𝒅𝒎𝒊𝒏𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 𝒆𝒙𝒕𝒆𝒏𝒅𝒔 𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 { 𝒗𝒐𝒊𝒅 𝒂𝒖𝒕𝒉𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒊𝒄𝒂𝒕𝒆() { 𝑺𝒚𝒔𝒕𝒆𝒎.𝒐𝒖𝒕.𝒑𝒓𝒊𝒏𝒕𝒍𝒏("𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 𝒂𝒔 𝑨𝒅𝒎𝒊𝒏"); }}𝒑𝒖𝒃𝒍𝒊𝒄 𝒄𝒍𝒂𝒔𝒔 𝑻𝒆𝒔𝒕 { 𝒑𝒖𝒃𝒍𝒊𝒄 𝒔𝒕𝒂𝒕𝒊𝒄 𝒗𝒐𝒊𝒅 𝒎𝒂𝒊𝒏(𝑺𝒕𝒓𝒊𝒏𝒈[] 𝒂𝒓𝒈𝒔) { 𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 𝒐𝒃𝒋 = 𝒏𝒆𝒘 𝑨𝒅𝒎𝒊𝒏𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏(); // 👈 𝑹𝒆𝒇𝒆𝒓𝒆𝒏𝒄𝒆 𝒕𝒚𝒑𝒆: 𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 | 𝑶𝒃𝒋𝒆𝒄𝒕 𝒕𝒚𝒑𝒆:𝑨𝒅𝒎𝒊𝒏𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 𝒐𝒃𝒋.𝒂𝒖𝒕𝒉𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒊𝒄𝒂𝒕𝒆(); // 👈 𝑪𝒂𝒍𝒍𝒔 𝑨𝒅𝒎𝒊𝒏𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏’𝒔 𝒎𝒆𝒕𝒉𝒐𝒅 𝒂𝒕 𝒓𝒖𝒏𝒕𝒊𝒎𝒆(𝒅𝒚𝒏𝒂𝒎𝒊𝒄 𝒃𝒊𝒏𝒅𝒊𝒏𝒈) }}

HOW REMOTE WORK GIVES SMALL BUSINESSES A FIGHTING CHANCE In early 2020 as we contemplated or more like dreaded the idea of having the entire team working remotely, little did we know that remote work would be the silver lining we needed.Sure, we moved on from NGcareers in 2020 (after exiting to ROAM/Jobberman) but the lessons we got from working remotely in 2020 positioned us for our next venture.When we started Remote4Africa there was no question of whether to be a remote company or not. The very nature of Remote4Africa meant we had to live what we preached - full remote operation.SO HOW DOES WORKING REMOTELY FAVOUR THE SMALL GUY? As a small, medium or growing company remote work gives you several advantages. Forget the naysayers and come with me. The two biggest advantages;Bigger Talent Pool As a remote company you are not restricted to just one city in your search for talent to help grow the company. You can literally hire smart young people from across the entire country or even continent (We help companies hire remotely - https://lnkd.in/g5-2qm2p). Your talent pool becomes automatically wider. Greater Cost EfficiencyA startup or small business usually doesn’t have endless money, in fact most struggle financially in the early years until their products/services start to generate significant revenue to outpace expenses. So how do you keep yourself in the game and extend the chances of your business surviving? By keeping expenses as low as possible. Going remote does that for you. We spent millions annually in office rent in Lagos. That was money that could have gone into marketing or direct revenue impacting activity. If you are building/growing a business in any major African city you know office costs are a significant part of your expenses. Aside rent you are talking about utilities, furniture etc.You can take some of that saving and give your remote staff stuff like data allowances, workspace allowances etc to help them set up and work comfortably from home.If you run a company/business and thinking of going remote you can reach out and ask any questions. I’ll be glad to advise and share lessons from what we’ve learnt running a remote company for 5 years now.hashtag#hiringremote hashtag#remotecompanies hashtag#businesstips hashtag#recruitingtips

Day:-8 Learning selenium with java (Automation)✅"Before diving into Selenium with Java, it's important to have a good understanding of Core Java topics."🌟 What is Exception Handling?Exception handling is a way to manage errors that occur while a program is running. Instead of stopping the entire program when an error happens, exception handling lets you control what should happen when something goes wrong.🌟 Why is it important?It helps prevent the program from crashing.It allows the program to continue running even after an error.It shows clear and friendly error messages to the user.It makes debugging and fixing issues easier.🌟 How does it work?You write the code that might cause an error inside a special block. If an error happens, another block will handle it. This keeps the program safe and avoids unexpected crashes.🌟 Key Terms:Try: The block where you write the code that might cause an error.Catch: The block where you handle the error if it occurs.Finally: A block that runs no matter what—whether there was an error or not.Throw: Used to create custom errors or exceptions.Throws: Used to declare exceptions that a method might cause.

Today's Learning Journey 📕: Stacks in JavaToday, I explored one of the fundamental data structures— the Stack.**What is a Stack?** A Stack is a linear data structure that follows the LIFO (Last In, First Out) principle. The last element added is the first one to be removed. Think of it like a stack of plates — you add to the top and remove from the top.**Why It's Important?** Stacks are used in many areas like function calls, expression evaluation, undo features in editors, and more. Understanding how they work is essential for solving real-world problems and mastering algorithms.**Key Takeaways:** 1. Core Operations: push(), pop(), peek(), and isEmpty()2. Implementation: Explored Java's built-in Stack class and also implemented it manually using arrays and linked lists. 3. Applications: Helps build intuition for recursion, backtracking, and parsing tasks.hashtag#Java hashtag#DataStructures hashtag#Stack hashtag#CodingJourney hashtag#Programming hashtag#TechLearning

كلامنا النهاردة عن  JVM، JRE، وJDK... مين هم أبطال القصة؟في عالم جافا، عندنا 3 شخصيات رئيسية، وكل واحدة ليها دور مهم جدًا:يلا نغوص سوا في عالم JVM، JRE، وJDK ونفهم كل واحدة فيهم بتشتغل إزاي؟ 🧠 أولاً: JVM – Java Virtual Machine ده هو قلب القصة.تخيله كأنه "المترجم الذكي" اللي بياخد الـ Bytecode (ملفات .class) ويحوّله لحاجة الجهاز يفهمها وظيفته:يقرأ ملفات .class اللي بيطلّعها الـ Compilerيفسرها سطر بسطر ويحوّلها لـ Machine Codeيتعامل مع نظام التشغيل (Windows / Linux / macOS)بيشتغل على أي جهاز فيه JVM → عشان كده جافا بتشتغل في كل مكان!أنواعه: كل نظام تشغيل ليه JVM خاصة بيه. الكود بيشتغل على أي نظام بشرط يكون فيه JVM.🌱 ثانيًا: JRE – Java Runtime Environment📦 دي البيئة اللي بيعيش فيها برنامج جافا بعد ما تكتبه.بتتكوّن من:JVMJava Class Libraries (زي System.out, ArrayList, Scanner, …)وظيفتها: تشغّل برامج جافا الجاهزة، بس مش ينفع تكتبي أو ترجمي كود جديد بيها. مثال: لو عندك برنامج جاهز وعايزة تشغّليه → محتاجة JRE فقط.🔧 ثالثًا: JDK – Java Development Kitدي العُدّة الكاملة لأي مطوّر/مطوّرة جافا.بتحتوي على:✅ كل مكونات الـ JRE✅ أدوات التطوير (Dev Tools):javac: لتحويل الكود لـ Bytecodejava: لتشغيل البرامجjavadoc: لتوليد التوثيقDebuggers: لتتبع الأخطاءوظيفتها:كتابة الكودترجمتهتشغيلهاختباره يعني باختصار: لو هتشتغل على مشروع جافا → لازم تنزّل الـ JDK الـ JRE لوحده مش هيكفي.لو وصلت لحد هنا، شاركني: أنت كنت عارف الفرق بينهم قبل كده؟ ولا دي أول مرة الصورة توضح؟ 😊👇hashtag#Java hashtag#JVM hashtag#JRE hashtag#JDK hashtag#LearnJava hashtag#Backend hashtag#ProgrammingBasics hashtag#لينكدإن

In Java, the final keyword is used to restrict the modification of variables, methods, and classes. There are 3 ways to input in the final keyword.. 3 ways to constext -:-->Final Variable-:A final variable cannot be reassigned after it has been initialized.For objects, final means the reference cannot change, but the object's contents can (unless the object itself is immutable).-->Final Method-:A final method cannot be overridden by subclasses.-->Final Class-:A final class cannot be extended (no subclassing).hashtag#Java hashtag#Coding hashtag#Learning hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment hashtag#Programming hashtag#TechJourney

Day:-8 Learning selenium with java (Automation)✅"Before diving into Selenium with Java, it's important to have a good understanding of Core Java topics."🌟 What is a Package?A package is like a folder in your computer that helps you organize your Java files (classes, interfaces, etc.).🌟 Why do we use Packages?To organize code neatlyTo avoid name conflicts (two classes can have the same name if they are in different packages)To reuse code easilyTo make project structure clean and easy to manage🌟 Types of Packages:Built-in packages – already available in Java (like java.util, java.io)User-defined packages – created by us to group our own classes🌟 How to Create and Use a Package?You create a package using the package keyword.You use it by importing it with the import keyword.🌟 Think of it like this:Your computer has folders (packages)Inside folders, you have files (Java classes)You can open and use files from any folder using the correct path (importing the package)

Method signature must be exactly the same2. Return type must be the same or covariant3. Access modifier can be more permissive (not more restrictive)4. Happens only in inheritance5. Enables runtime polymorphism⚡ 𝐃𝐲𝐧𝐚𝐦𝐢𝐜 𝐁𝐢𝐧𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠 (𝐚.𝐤.𝐚 𝐋𝐚𝐭𝐞 𝐁𝐢𝐧𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠) ✅ The method to execute is decided at runtime 🔹 Used when:1. You're overriding methods2. Based on object type, not the reference type📌 | 𝐉𝐚𝐯𝐚 𝐝𝐞𝐭𝐞𝐫𝐦𝐢𝐧𝐞𝐬 𝐚𝐭 𝐫𝐮𝐧𝐭𝐢𝐦𝐞 𝐰𝐡𝐢𝐜𝐡 𝐨𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐫𝐢𝐝𝐝𝐞𝐧 𝐦𝐞𝐭𝐡𝐨𝐝 𝐭𝐨 𝐞𝐱𝐞𝐜𝐮𝐭𝐞 𝐛𝐚𝐬𝐞𝐝 𝐨𝐧 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐨𝐛𝐣𝐞𝐜𝐭 𝐭𝐲𝐩𝐞🛠️ 𝐑𝐮𝐧𝐭𝐢𝐦𝐞 𝐏𝐨𝐥𝐲𝐦𝐨𝐫𝐩𝐡𝐢𝐬𝐦 ✅ Occurs when a parent class reference is used to call an overridden method in the child class✅ Example: Run-Time Polymorphism (via Method Over-riding) java𝒄𝒍𝒂𝒔𝒔 𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 { 𝒗𝒐𝒊𝒅 𝒂𝒖𝒕𝒉𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒊𝒄𝒂𝒕𝒆() { 𝑺𝒚𝒔𝒕𝒆𝒎.𝒐𝒖𝒕.𝒑𝒓𝒊𝒏𝒕𝒍𝒏("𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 𝒂𝒔 𝑮𝒖𝒆𝒔𝒕"); }}𝒄𝒍𝒂𝒔𝒔 𝑨𝒅𝒎𝒊𝒏𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 𝒆𝒙𝒕𝒆𝒏𝒅𝒔 𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 { 𝒗𝒐𝒊𝒅 𝒂𝒖𝒕𝒉𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒊𝒄𝒂𝒕𝒆() { 𝑺𝒚𝒔𝒕𝒆𝒎.𝒐𝒖𝒕.𝒑𝒓𝒊𝒏𝒕𝒍𝒏("𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 𝒂𝒔 𝑨𝒅𝒎𝒊𝒏"); }}𝒑𝒖𝒃𝒍𝒊𝒄 𝒄𝒍𝒂𝒔𝒔 𝑻𝒆𝒔𝒕 { 𝒑𝒖𝒃𝒍𝒊𝒄 𝒔𝒕𝒂𝒕𝒊𝒄 𝒗𝒐𝒊𝒅 𝒎𝒂𝒊𝒏(𝑺𝒕𝒓𝒊𝒏𝒈[] 𝒂𝒓𝒈𝒔) { 𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 𝒐𝒃𝒋 = 𝒏𝒆𝒘 𝑨𝒅𝒎𝒊𝒏𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏(); // 👈 𝑹𝒆𝒇𝒆𝒓𝒆𝒏𝒄𝒆 𝒕𝒚𝒑𝒆: 𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 | 𝑶𝒃𝒋𝒆𝒄𝒕 𝒕𝒚𝒑𝒆:𝑨𝒅𝒎𝒊𝒏𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 𝒐𝒃𝒋.𝒂𝒖𝒕𝒉𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒊𝒄𝒂𝒕𝒆(); // 👈 𝑪𝒂𝒍𝒍𝒔 𝑨𝒅𝒎𝒊𝒏𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏’𝒔 𝒎𝒆𝒕𝒉𝒐𝒅 𝒂𝒕 𝒓𝒖𝒏𝒕𝒊𝒎𝒆(𝒅𝒚𝒏𝒂𝒎𝒊𝒄 𝒃𝒊𝒏𝒅𝒊𝒏𝒈) }}

HOW REMOTE WORK GIVES SMALL BUSINESSES A FIGHTING CHANCE In early 2020 as we contemplated or more like dreaded the idea of having the entire team working remotely, little did we know that remote work would be the silver lining we needed.Sure, we moved on from NGcareers in 2020 (after exiting to ROAM/Jobberman) but the lessons we got from working remotely in 2020 positioned us for our next venture.When we started Remote4Africa there was no question of whether to be a remote company or not. The very nature of Remote4Africa meant we had to live what we preached - full remote operation.SO HOW DOES WORKING REMOTELY FAVOUR THE SMALL GUY? As a small, medium or growing company remote work gives you several advantages. Forget the naysayers and come with me. The two biggest advantages;Bigger Talent Pool As a remote company you are not restricted to just one city in your search for talent to help grow the company. You can literally hire smart young people from across the entire country or even continent (We help companies hire remotely - https://lnkd.in/g5-2qm2p). Your talent pool becomes automatically wider. Greater Cost EfficiencyA startup or small business usually doesn’t have endless money, in fact most struggle financially in the early years until their products/services start to generate significant revenue to outpace expenses. So how do you keep yourself in the game and extend the chances of your business surviving? By keeping expenses as low as possible. Going remote does that for you. We spent millions annually in office rent in Lagos. That was money that could have gone into marketing or direct revenue impacting activity. If you are building/growing a business in any major African city you know office costs are a significant part of your expenses. Aside rent you are talking about utilities, furniture etc.You can take some of that saving and give your remote staff stuff like data allowances, workspace allowances etc to help them set up and work comfortably from home.If you run a company/business and thinking of going remote you can reach out and ask any questions. I’ll be glad to advise and share lessons from what we’ve learnt running a remote company for 5 years now.hashtag#hiringremote hashtag#remotecompanies hashtag#businesstips hashtag#recruitingtips

Day:-8 Learning selenium with java (Automation)✅"Before diving into Selenium with Java, it's important to have a good understanding of Core Java topics."🌟 What is Exception Handling?Exception handling is a way to manage errors that occur while a program is running. Instead of stopping the entire program when an error happens, exception handling lets you control what should happen when something goes wrong.🌟 Why is it important?It helps prevent the program from crashing.It allows the program to continue running even after an error.It shows clear and friendly error messages to the user.It makes debugging and fixing issues easier.🌟 How does it work?You write the code that might cause an error inside a special block. If an error happens, another block will handle it. This keeps the program safe and avoids unexpected crashes.🌟 Key Terms:Try: The block where you write the code that might cause an error.Catch: The block where you handle the error if it occurs.Finally: A block that runs no matter what—whether there was an error or not.Throw: Used to create custom errors or exceptions.Throws: Used to declare exceptions that a method might cause.

Today's Learning Journey 📕: Stacks in JavaToday, I explored one of the fundamental data structures— the Stack.**What is a Stack?** A Stack is a linear data structure that follows the LIFO (Last In, First Out) principle. The last element added is the first one to be removed. Think of it like a stack of plates — you add to the top and remove from the top.**Why It's Important?** Stacks are used in many areas like function calls, expression evaluation, undo features in editors, and more. Understanding how they work is essential for solving real-world problems and mastering algorithms.**Key Takeaways:** 1. Core Operations: push(), pop(), peek(), and isEmpty()2. Implementation: Explored Java's built-in Stack class and also implemented it manually using arrays and linked lists. 3. كلامنا النهاردة عن  JVM، JRE، وJDK... مين هم أبطال القصة؟في عالم جافا، عندنا 3 شخصيات رئيسية، وكل واحدة ليها دور مهم جدًا:يلا نغوص سوا في عالم JVM، JRE، وJDK ونفهم كل واحدة فيهم بتشتغل إزاي؟ 🧠 أولاً: JVM – Java Virtual Machine ده هو قلب القصة.تخيله كأنه "المترجم الذكي" اللي بياخد الـ Bytecode (ملفات .class) ويحوّله لحاجة الجهاز يفهمها وظيفته:يقرأ ملفات .class اللي بيطلّعها الـ Compilerيفسرها سطر بسطر ويحوّلها لـ Machine Codeيتعامل مع نظام التشغيل (Windows / Linux / macOS)بيشتغل على أي جهاز فيه JVM → عشان كده جافا بتشتغل في كل مكان!أنواعه: كل نظام تشغيل ليه JVM خاصة بيه. الكود بيشتغل على أي نظام بشرط يكون فيه JVM.🌱 ثانيًا: JRE – Java Runtime Environment📦 دي البيئة اللي بيعيش فيها برنامج جافا بعد ما تكتبه.بتتكوّن من:JVMJava Class Libraries (زي System.out, ArrayList, Scanner, …)وظيفتها: تشغّل برامج جافا الجاهزة، بس مش ينفع تكتبي أو ترجمي كود جديد بيها. مثال: لو عندك برنامج جاهز وعايزة تشغّليه → محتاجة JRE فقط.🔧 ثالثًا: JDK – Java Development Kitدي العُدّة الكاملة لأي مطوّر/مطوّرة جافا.بتحتوي على:✅ كل مكونات الـ JRE✅ أدوات التطوير (Dev Tools):javac: لتحويل الكود لـ Bytecodejava: لتشغيل البرامجjavadoc: لتوليد التوثيقDebuggers: لتتبع الأخطاءوظيفتها:كتابة الكودترجمتهتشغيلهاختباره يعني باختصار: لو هتشتغل على مشروع جافا → لازم تنزّل الـ JDK الـ JRE لوحده مش هيكفي.لو وصلت لحد هنا، شاركني: أنت كنت عارف الفرق بينهم قبل كده؟ ولا دي أول مرة الصورة توضح؟ 😊👇hashtag#Java hashtag#JVM hashtag#JRE hashtag#JDK hashtag#LearnJava hashtag#Backend hashtag#ProgrammingBasics hashtag#لينكدإن

In Java, the final keyword is used to restrict the modification of variables, methods, and classes. There are 3 ways to input in the final keyword.. 3 ways to constext -:-->Final Variable-:A final variable cannot be reassigned after it has been initialized.For objects, final means the reference cannot change, but the object's contents can (unless the object itself is immutable).-->Final Method-:A final method cannot be overridden by subclasses.-->Final Class-:A final class cannot be extended (no subclassing).hashtag#Java hashtag#Coding hashtag#Learning hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment hashtag#Programming hashtag#TechJourney

Day:-8 Learning selenium with java (Automation)✅"Before diving into Selenium with Java, it's important to have a good understanding of Core Java topics."🌟 What is a Package?A package is like a folder in your computer that helps you organize your Java files (classes, interfaces, etc.).🌟 Why do we use Packages?To organize code neatlyTo avoid name conflicts (two classes can have the same name if they are in different packages)To reuse code easilyTo make project structure clean and easy to manage🌟 Types of Packages:Built-in packages – already available in Java (like java.util, java.io)User-defined packages – created by us to group our own classes🌟 How to Create and Use a Package?You create a package using the package keyword.You use it by importing it with the import keyword.🌟 Think of it like this:Your computer has folders (packages)Inside folders, you have files (Java classes)You can open and use files from any folder using the correct path (importing the package)

🔁 𝐌𝐞𝐭𝐡𝐨𝐝 𝐎𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐫𝐢𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠, 𝐃𝐲𝐧𝐚𝐦𝐢𝐜 𝐁𝐢𝐧𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠 & 𝐑𝐮𝐧𝐭𝐢𝐦𝐞 𝐏𝐨𝐥𝐲𝐦𝐨𝐫𝐩𝐡𝐢𝐬𝐦 — 𝐒𝐢𝐦𝐩𝐥𝐢𝐟𝐢𝐞𝐝!If you're working with inheritance in Java or automation frameworks like Selenium, this is one of the most powerful concepts👇🔁 𝐌𝐞𝐭𝐡𝐨𝐝 𝐎𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐫𝐢𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠 ✅ Definition: Redefining a method of the parent class in the child class🔹 Key Rules:1. Method signature must be exactly the same2. Return type must be the same or covariant3. Access modifier can be more permissive (not more restrictive)4. Happens only in inheritance5. Enables runtime polymorphism⚡ 𝐃𝐲𝐧𝐚𝐦𝐢𝐜 𝐁𝐢𝐧𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠 (𝐚.𝐤.𝐚 𝐋𝐚𝐭𝐞 𝐁𝐢𝐧𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠) ✅ The method to execute is decided at runtime 🔹 Used when:1. You're overriding methods2. Based on object type, not the reference type📌 | 𝐉𝐚𝐯𝐚 𝐝𝐞𝐭𝐞𝐫𝐦𝐢𝐧𝐞𝐬 𝐚𝐭 𝐫𝐮𝐧𝐭𝐢𝐦𝐞 𝐰𝐡𝐢𝐜𝐡 𝐨𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐫𝐢𝐝𝐝𝐞𝐧 𝐦𝐞𝐭𝐡𝐨𝐝 𝐭𝐨 𝐞𝐱𝐞𝐜𝐮𝐭𝐞 𝐛𝐚𝐬𝐞𝐝 𝐨𝐧 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐨𝐛𝐣𝐞𝐜𝐭 𝐭𝐲𝐩𝐞🛠️ 𝐑𝐮𝐧𝐭𝐢𝐦𝐞 𝐏𝐨𝐥𝐲𝐦𝐨𝐫𝐩𝐡𝐢𝐬𝐦 ✅ Occurs when a parent class reference is used to call an overridden method in the child class✅ Example: Run-Time Polymorphism (via Method Over-riding) java𝒄𝒍𝒂𝒔𝒔 𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 { 𝒗𝒐𝒊𝒅 𝒂𝒖𝒕𝒉𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒊𝒄𝒂𝒕𝒆() { 𝑺𝒚𝒔𝒕𝒆𝒎.𝒐𝒖𝒕.𝒑𝒓𝒊𝒏𝒕𝒍𝒏("𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 𝒂𝒔 𝑮𝒖𝒆𝒔𝒕"); }}𝒄𝒍𝒂𝒔𝒔 𝑨𝒅𝒎𝒊𝒏𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 𝒆𝒙𝒕𝒆𝒏𝒅𝒔 𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 { 𝒗𝒐𝒊𝒅 𝒂𝒖𝒕𝒉𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒊𝒄𝒂𝒕𝒆() { 𝑺𝒚𝒔𝒕𝒆𝒎.𝒐𝒖𝒕.𝒑𝒓𝒊𝒏𝒕𝒍𝒏("𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 𝒂𝒔 𝑨𝒅𝒎𝒊𝒏"); }}𝒑𝒖𝒃𝒍𝒊𝒄 𝒄𝒍𝒂𝒔𝒔 𝑻𝒆𝒔𝒕 { 𝒑𝒖𝒃𝒍𝒊𝒄 𝒔𝒕𝒂𝒕𝒊𝒄 𝒗𝒐𝒊𝒅 𝒎𝒂𝒊𝒏(𝑺𝒕𝒓𝒊𝒏𝒈[] 𝒂𝒓𝒈𝒔) { 𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 𝒐𝒃𝒋 = 𝒏𝒆𝒘 𝑨𝒅𝒎𝒊𝒏𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏(); // 👈 𝑹𝒆𝒇𝒆𝒓𝒆𝒏𝒄𝒆 𝒕𝒚𝒑𝒆: 𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 | 𝑶𝒃𝒋𝒆𝒄𝒕 𝒕𝒚𝒑𝒆:𝑨𝒅𝒎𝒊𝒏𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 𝒐𝒃𝒋.𝒂𝒖𝒕𝒉𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒊𝒄𝒂𝒕𝒆(); // 👈 𝑪𝒂𝒍𝒍𝒔 𝑨𝒅𝒎𝒊𝒏𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏’𝒔 𝒎𝒆𝒕𝒉𝒐𝒅 𝒂𝒕 𝒓𝒖𝒏𝒕𝒊𝒎𝒆(𝒅𝒚𝒏𝒂𝒎𝒊𝒄 𝒃𝒊𝒏𝒅𝒊𝒏𝒈) }}

HOW REMOTE WORK GIVES SMALL BUSINESSES A FIGHTING CHANCE In early 2020 as we contemplated or more like dreaded the idea of having the entire team working remotely, little did we know that remote work would be the silver lining we needed.Sure, we moved on from NGcareers in 2020 (after exiting to ROAM/Jobberman) but the lessons we got from working remotely in 2020 positioned us for our next venture.When we started Remote4Africa there was no question of whether to be a remote company or not. The very nature of Remote4Africa meant we had to live what we preached - full remote operation.SO HOW DOES WORKING REMOTELY FAVOUR THE SMALL GUY? As a small, medium or growing company remote work gives you several advantages. Forget the naysayers and come with me. The two biggest advantages;Bigger Talent Pool As a remote company you are not restricted to just one city in your search for talent to help grow the company. You can literally hire smart young people from across the entire country or even continent (We help companies hire remotely - https://lnkd.in/g5-2qm2p). Your talent pool becomes automatically wider. Greater Cost EfficiencyA startup or small business usually doesn’t have endless money, in fact most struggle financially in the early years until their products/services start to generate significant revenue to outpace expenses. So how do you keep yourself in the game and extend the chances of your business surviving? By keeping expenses as low as possible. Going remote does that for you. We spent millions annually in office rent in Lagos. That was money that could have gone into marketing or direct revenue impacting activity. If you are building/growing a business in any major African city you know office costs are a significant part of your expenses. Aside rent you are talking about utilities, furniture etc.You can take some of that saving and give your remote staff stuff like data allowances, workspace allowances etc to help them set up and work comfortably from home.If you run a company/business and thinking of going remote you can reach out and ask any questions. I’ll be glad to advise and share lessons from what we’ve learnt running a remote company for 5 years now.hashtag#hiringremote hashtag#remotecompanies hashtag#businesstips hashtag#recruitingtips

Day:-8 Learning selenium with java (Automation)✅"Before diving into Selenium with Java, it's important to have a good understanding of Core Java topics."🌟 What is Exception Handling?Exception handling is a way to manage errors that occur while a program is running. Instead of stopping the entire program when an error happens, exception handling lets you control what should happen when something goes wrong.🌟 Why is it important?It helps prevent the program from crashing.It allows the program to continue running even after an error.It shows clear and friendly error messages to the user.It makes debugging and fixing issues easier.🌟 How does it work?You write the code that might cause an error inside a special block. If an error happens, another block will handle it. This keeps the program safe and avoids unexpected crashes.🌟 Key Terms:Try: The block where you write the code that might cause an error.Catch: The block where you handle the error if it occurs.Finally: A block that runs no matter what—whether there was an error or not.Throw: Used to create custom errors or exceptions.Throws: Used to declare exceptions that a method might cause.

Today's Learning Journey 📕: Stacks in JavaToday, I explored one of the fundamental data structures— the Stack.**What is a Stack?** A Stack is a linear data structure that follows the LIFO (Last In, First Out) principle. The last element added is the first one to be removed. Think of it like a stack of plates — you add to the top and remove from the top.**Why It's Important?** Stacks are used in many areas like function calls, expression evaluation, undo features in editors, and more. Understanding how they work is essential for solving real-world problems and mastering algorithms.**Key Takeaways:** 1. Core Operations: push(), pop(), peek(), and isEmpty()2. Implementation: Explored Java's built-in Stack class and also implemented it manually using arrays and linked lists. 3. Applications: Helps build intuition for recursion, backtracking, and parsing tasks.hashtag#Java hashtag#DataStructures hashtag#Stack hashtag#CodingJourney hashtag#Programming hashtag#TechLearning

كلامنا النهاردة عن  JVM، JRE، وJDK... مين هم أبطال القصة؟في عالم جافا، عندنا 3 شخصيات رئيسية، وكل واحدة ليها دور مهم جدًا:يلا نغوص سوا في عالم JVM، JRE، وJDK ونفهم كل واحدة فيهم بتشتغل إزاي؟ 🧠 أولاً: JVM – Java Virtual Machine ده هو قلب القصة.تخيله كأنه "المترجم الذكي" اللي بياخد الـ Bytecode (ملفات .class) ويحوّله لحاجة الجهاز يفهمها وظيفته:يقرأ ملفات .class اللي بيطلّعها الـ Compilerيفسرها سطر بسطر ويحوّلها لـ Machine Codeيتعامل مع نظام التشغيل (Windows / Linux / macOS)بيشتغل على أي جهاز فيه JVM → عشان كده جافا بتشتغل في كل مكان!أنواعه: كل نظام تشغيل ليه JVM خاصة بيه. الكود بيشتغل على أي نظام بشرط يكون فيه JVM.🌱 ثانيًا: JRE – Java Runtime Environment📦 دي البيئة اللي بيعيش فيها برنامج جافا بعد ما تكتبه.بتتكوّن من:JVMJava Class Libraries (زي System.out, ArrayList, Scanner, …)وظيفتها: تشغّل برامج جافا الجاهزة، بس مش ينفع تكتبي أو ترجمي كود جديد بيها. مثال: لو عندك برنامج جاهز وعايزة تشغّليه → محتاجة JRE فقط.🔧 ثالثًا: JDK – Java Development Kitدي العُدّة الكاملة لأي مطوّر/مطوّرة جافا.بتحتوي على:✅ كل مكونات الـ JRE✅ أدوات التطوير (Dev Tools):javac: لتحويل الكود لـ Bytecodejava: لتشغيل البرامجjavadoc: لتوليد التوثيقDebuggers: لتتبع الأخطاءوظيفتها:كتابة الكودترجمتهتشغيلهاختباره يعني باختصار: لو هتشتغل على مشروع جافا → لازم تنزّل الـ JDK الـ JRE لوحده مش هيكفي.لو وصلت لحد هنا، شاركني: أنت كنت عارف الفرق بينهم قبل كده؟ ولا دي أول مرة الصورة توضح؟ 😊👇hashtag#Java hashtag#JVM hashtag#JRE hashtag#JDK hashtag#LearnJava hashtag#Backend hashtag#ProgrammingBasics hashtag#لينكدإن

In Java, the final keyword is used to restrict the modification of variables, methods, and classes. There are 3 ways to input in the final keyword.. 3 ways to constext -:-->Final Variable-:A final variable cannot be reassigned after it has been initialized.For objects, final means the reference cannot change, but the object's contents can (unless the object itself is immutable).-->Final Method-:A final method cannot be overridden by subclasses.-->Final Class-:A final class cannot be extended (no subclassing).hashtag#Java hashtag#Coding hashtag#Learning hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment hashtag#Programming hashtag#TechJourney

Day:-8 Learning selenium with java (Automation)✅"Before diving into Selenium with Java, it's important to have a good understanding of Core Java topics."🌟 What is a Package?A package is like a folder in your computer that helps you organize your Java files (classes, interfaces, etc.).🌟 Why do we use Packages?To organize code neatlyTo avoid name conflicts (two classes can have the same name if they are in different packages)To reuse code easilyTo make project structure clean and easy to manage🌟 Types of Packages:Built-in packages – already available in Java (like java.util, java.io)User-defined packages – created by us to group our own classes🌟 How to Create and Use a Package?You create a package using the package keyword.You use it by importing it with the import keyword.🌟 Think of it like this:Your computer has folders (packages)Inside folders, you have files (Java classes)You can open and use files from any folder using the correct path (importing the package)

🔁 𝐌𝐞𝐭𝐡𝐨𝐝 𝐎𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐫𝐢𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠, 𝐃𝐲𝐧𝐚𝐦𝐢𝐜 𝐁𝐢𝐧𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠 & 𝐑𝐮𝐧𝐭𝐢𝐦𝐞 𝐏𝐨𝐥𝐲𝐦𝐨𝐫𝐩𝐡𝐢𝐬𝐦 — 𝐒𝐢𝐦𝐩𝐥𝐢𝐟𝐢𝐞𝐝!If you're working with inheritance in Java or automation frameworks like Selenium, this is one of the most powerful concepts👇🔁 𝐌𝐞𝐭𝐡𝐨𝐝 𝐎𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐫𝐢𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠 ✅ Definition: Redefining a method of the parent class in the child class🔹 Key Rules:1. Method signature must be exactly the same2. Return type must be the same or covariant3. Access modifier can be more permissive (not more restrictive)4. Happens only in inheritance5. Enables runtime polymorphism⚡ 𝐃𝐲𝐧𝐚𝐦𝐢𝐜 𝐁𝐢𝐧𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠 (𝐚.𝐤.𝐚 𝐋𝐚𝐭𝐞 𝐁𝐢𝐧𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠) ✅ The method to execute is decided at runtime 🔹 Used when:1. You're overriding methods2. Based on object type, not the reference type📌 | 𝐉𝐚𝐯𝐚 𝐝𝐞𝐭𝐞𝐫𝐦𝐢𝐧𝐞𝐬 𝐚𝐭 𝐫𝐮𝐧𝐭𝐢𝐦𝐞 𝐰𝐡𝐢𝐜𝐡 𝐨𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐫𝐢𝐝𝐝𝐞𝐧 𝐦𝐞𝐭𝐡𝐨𝐝 𝐭𝐨 𝐞𝐱𝐞𝐜𝐮𝐭𝐞 𝐛𝐚𝐬𝐞𝐝 𝐨𝐧 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐨𝐛𝐣𝐞𝐜𝐭 𝐭𝐲𝐩𝐞🛠️ 𝐑𝐮𝐧𝐭𝐢𝐦𝐞 𝐏𝐨𝐥𝐲𝐦𝐨𝐫𝐩𝐡𝐢𝐬𝐦 ✅ Occurs when a parent class reference is used to call an overridden method in the child class✅ Example: Run-Time Polymorphism (via Method Over-riding) java𝒄𝒍𝒂𝒔𝒔 𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 { 𝒗𝒐𝒊𝒅 𝒂𝒖𝒕𝒉𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒊𝒄𝒂𝒕𝒆() { 𝑺𝒚𝒔𝒕𝒆𝒎.𝒐𝒖𝒕.𝒑𝒓𝒊𝒏𝒕𝒍𝒏("𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 𝒂𝒔 𝑮𝒖𝒆𝒔𝒕"); }}𝒄𝒍𝒂𝒔𝒔 𝑨𝒅𝒎𝒊𝒏𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 𝒆𝒙𝒕𝒆𝒏𝒅𝒔 𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 { 𝒗𝒐𝒊𝒅 𝒂𝒖𝒕𝒉𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒊𝒄𝒂𝒕𝒆() { 𝑺𝒚𝒔𝒕𝒆𝒎.𝒐𝒖𝒕.𝒑𝒓𝒊𝒏𝒕𝒍𝒏("𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 𝒂𝒔 𝑨𝒅𝒎𝒊𝒏"); }}𝒑𝒖𝒃𝒍𝒊𝒄 𝒄𝒍𝒂𝒔𝒔 𝑻𝒆𝒔𝒕 { 𝒑𝒖𝒃𝒍𝒊𝒄 𝒔𝒕𝒂𝒕𝒊𝒄 𝒗𝒐𝒊𝒅 𝒎𝒂𝒊𝒏(𝑺𝒕𝒓𝒊𝒏𝒈[] 𝒂𝒓𝒈𝒔) { 𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 𝒐𝒃𝒋 = 𝒏𝒆𝒘 𝑨𝒅𝒎𝒊𝒏𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏(); // 👈 𝑹𝒆𝒇𝒆𝒓𝒆𝒏𝒄𝒆 𝒕𝒚𝒑𝒆: 𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 | 𝑶𝒃𝒋𝒆𝒄𝒕 𝒕𝒚𝒑𝒆:𝑨𝒅𝒎𝒊𝒏𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 𝒐𝒃𝒋.𝒂𝒖𝒕𝒉𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒊𝒄𝒂𝒕𝒆(); // 👈 𝑪𝒂𝒍𝒍𝒔 𝑨𝒅𝒎𝒊𝒏𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏’𝒔 𝒎𝒆𝒕𝒉𝒐𝒅 𝒂𝒕 𝒓𝒖𝒏𝒕𝒊𝒎𝒆(𝒅𝒚𝒏𝒂𝒎𝒊𝒄 𝒃𝒊𝒏𝒅𝒊𝒏𝒈) }}

HOW REMOTE WORK GIVES SMALL BUSINESSES A FIGHTING CHANCE In early 2020 as we contemplated or more like dreaded the idea of having the entire team working remotely, little did we know that remote work would be the silver lining we needed.Sure, we moved on from NGcareers in 2020 (after exiting to ROAM/Jobberman) but the lessons we got from working remotely in 2020 positioned us for our next venture.When we started Remote4Africa there was no question of whether to be a remote company or not. The very nature of Remote4Africa meant we had to live what we preached - full remote operation.SO HOW DOES WORKING REMOTELY FAVOUR THE SMALL GUY? As a small, medium or growing company remote work gives you several advantages. Forget the naysayers and come with me. The two biggest advantages;Bigger Talent Pool As a remote company you are not restricted to just one city in your search for talent to help grow the company. You can literally hire smart young people from across the entire country or even continent (We help companies hire remotely - https://lnkd.in/g5-2qm2p). Your talent pool becomes automatically wider. Greater Cost EfficiencyA startup or small business usually doesn’t have endless money, in fact most struggle financially in the early years until their products/services start to generate significant revenue to outpace expenses. So how do you keep yourself in the game and extend the chances of your business surviving? By keeping expenses as low as possible. Going remote does that for you. We spent millions annually in office rent in Lagos. That was money that could have gone into marketing or direct revenue impacting activity. If you are building/growing a business in any major African city you know office costs are a significant part of your expenses. Aside rent you are talking about utilities, furniture etc.You can take some of that saving and give your remote staff stuff like data allowances, workspace allowances etc to help them set up and work comfortably from home.If you run a company/business and thinking of going remote you can reach out and ask any questions. I’ll be glad to advise and share lessons from what we’ve learnt running a remote company for 5 years now.hashtag#hiringremote hashtag#remotecompanies hashtag#businesstips hashtag#recruitingtips

Day:-8 Learning selenium with java (Automation)✅"Before diving into Selenium with Java, it's important to have a good understanding of Core Java topics."🌟 What is Exception Handling?Exception handling is a way to manage errors that occur while a program is running. Instead of stopping the entire program when an error happens, exception handling lets you control what should happen when something goes wrong.🌟 Why is it important?It helps prevent the program from crashing.It allows the program to continue running even after an error.It shows clear and friendly error messages to the user.It makes debugging and fixing issues easier.🌟 How does it work?You write the code that might cause an error inside a special block. If an error happens, another block will handle it. This keeps the program safe and avoids unexpected crashes.🌟 Key Terms:Try: The block where you write the code that might cause an error.Catch: The block where you handle the error if it occurs.Finally: A block that runs no matter what—whether there was an error or not.Throw: Used to create custom errors or exceptions.Throws: Used to declare exceptions that a method might cause.

Today's Learning Journey 📕: Stacks in JavaToday, I explored one of the fundamental data structures— the Stack.**What is a Stack?** A Stack is a linear data structure that follows the LIFO (Last In, First Out) principle. The last element added is the first one to be removed. Think of it like a stack of plates — you add to the top and remove from the top.**Why It's Important?** Stacks are used in many areas like function calls, expression evaluation, undo features in editors, and more. Understanding how they work is essential for solving real-world problems and mastering algorithms.**Key Takeaways:** 1. Core Operations: push(), pop(), peek(), and isEmpty()2. Implementation: Explored Java's built-in Stack class and also implemented it manually using arrays and linked lists. 3. Applications: Helps build intuition for recursion, backtracking, and parsing tasks.hashtag#Java hashtag#DataStructures hashtag#Stack hashtag#CodingJourney hashtag#Programming hashtag#TechLearning

كلامنا النهاردة عن  JVM، JRE، وJDK... مين هم أبطال القصة؟في عالم جافا، عندنا 3 شخصيات رئيسية، وكل واحدة ليها دور مهم جدًا:يلا نغوص سوا في عالم JVM، JRE، وJDK ونفهم كل واحدة فيهم بتشتغل إزاي؟ 🧠 أولاً: JVM – Java Virtual Machine ده هو قلب القصة.تخيله كأنه "المترجم الذكي" اللي بياخد الـ Bytecode (ملفات .class) ويحوّله لحاجة الجهاز يفهمها وظيفته:يقرأ ملفات .class اللي بيطلّعها الـ Compilerيفسرها سطر بسطر ويحوّلها لـ Machine Codeيتعامل مع نظام التشغيل (Windows / Linux / macOS)بيشتغل على أي جهاز فيه JVM → عشان كده جافا بتشتغل في كل مكان!أنواعه: كل نظام تشغيل ليه JVM خاصة بيه. الكود بيشتغل على أي نظام بشرط يكون فيه JVM.🌱 ثانيًا: JRE – Java Runtime Environment📦 دي البيئة اللي بيعيش فيها برنامج جافا بعد ما تكتبه.بتتكوّن من:JVMJava Class Libraries (زي System.out, ArrayList, Scanner, …)وظيفتها: تشغّل برامج جافا الجاهزة، بس مش ينفع تكتبي أو ترجمي كود جديد بيها. مثال: لو عندك برنامج جاهز وعايزة تشغّليه → محتاجة JRE فقط.🔧 ثالثًا: JDK – Java Development Kitدي العُدّة الكاملة لأي مطوّر/مطوّرة جافا.بتحتوي على:✅ كل مكونات الـ JRE✅ أدوات التطوير (Dev Tools):javac: لتحويل الكود لـ Bytecodejava: لتشغيل البرامجjavadoc: لتوليد التوثيقDebuggers: لتتبع الأخطاءوظيفتها:كتابة الكودترجمتهتشغيلهاختباره يعني باختصار: لو هتشتغل على مشروع جافا → لازم تنزّل الـ JDK الـ JRE لوحده مش هيكفي.لو وصلت لحد هنا، شاركني: أنت كنت عارف الفرق بينهم قبل كده؟ ولا دي أول مرة الصورة توضح؟ 😊👇hashtag#Java hashtag#JVM hashtag#JRE hashtag#JDK hashtag#LearnJava hashtag#Backend hashtag#ProgrammingBasics hashtag#لينكدإن

🚀 My Java Journey: From Basics to Building Real-World Applications ☕✨✨✨Day 40🌄🌄Using of Final Keyword.... In Java, the final keyword is used to restrict the modification of variables, methods, and classes. There are 3 ways to input in the final keyword.. 3 ways to constext -:-->Final Variable-:A final variable cannot be reassigned after it has been initialized.For objects, final means the reference cannot change, but the object's contents can (unless the object itself is immutable).-->Final Method-:A final method cannot be overridden by subclasses.-->Final Class-:A final class cannot be extended (no subclassing).hashtag#Java hashtag#Coding hashtag#Learning hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment hashtag#Programming hashtag#TechJourney

Day:-8 Learning selenium with java (Automation)✅"Before diving into Selenium with Java, it's important to have a good understanding of Core Java topics."🌟 What is a Package?A package is like a folder in your computer that helps you organize your Java files (classes, interfaces, etc.).🌟 Why do we use Packages?To organize code neatlyTo avoid name conflicts (two classes can have the same name if they are in different packages)To reuse code easilyTo make project structure clean and easy to manage🌟 Types of Packages:Built-in packages – already available in Java (like java.util, java.io)User-defined packages – created by us to group our own classes🌟 How to Create and Use a Package?You create a package using the package keyword.You use it by importing it with the import keyword.🌟 Think of it like this:Your computer has folders (packages)Inside folders, you have files (Java classes)You can open and use files from any folder using the correct path (importing the package)

🔁 𝐌𝐞𝐭𝐡𝐨𝐝 𝐎𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐫𝐢𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠, 𝐃𝐲𝐧𝐚𝐦𝐢𝐜 𝐁𝐢𝐧𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠 & 𝐑𝐮𝐧𝐭𝐢𝐦𝐞 𝐏𝐨𝐥𝐲𝐦𝐨𝐫𝐩𝐡𝐢𝐬𝐦 — 𝐒𝐢𝐦𝐩𝐥𝐢𝐟𝐢𝐞𝐝!If you're working with inheritance in Java or automation frameworks like Selenium, this is one of the most powerful concepts👇🔁 𝐌𝐞𝐭𝐡𝐨𝐝 𝐎𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐫𝐢𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠 ✅ Definition: Redefining a method of the parent class in the child class🔹 Key Rules:1. Method signature must be exactly the same2. Return type must be the same or covariant3. Access modifier can be more permissive (not more restrictive)4. Happens only in inheritance5. Enables runtime polymorphism⚡ 𝐃𝐲𝐧𝐚𝐦𝐢𝐜 𝐁𝐢𝐧𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠 (𝐚.𝐤.𝐚 𝐋𝐚𝐭𝐞 𝐁𝐢𝐧𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠) ✅ The method to execute is decided at runtime 🔹 Used when:1. You're overriding methods2. Based on object type, not the reference type📌 | 𝐉𝐚𝐯𝐚 𝐝𝐞𝐭𝐞𝐫𝐦𝐢𝐧𝐞𝐬 𝐚𝐭 𝐫𝐮𝐧𝐭𝐢𝐦𝐞 𝐰𝐡𝐢𝐜𝐡 𝐨𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐫𝐢𝐝𝐝𝐞𝐧 𝐦𝐞𝐭𝐡𝐨𝐝 𝐭𝐨 𝐞𝐱𝐞𝐜𝐮𝐭𝐞 𝐛𝐚𝐬𝐞𝐝 𝐨𝐧 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐨𝐛𝐣𝐞𝐜𝐭 𝐭𝐲𝐩𝐞🛠️ 𝐑𝐮𝐧𝐭𝐢𝐦𝐞 𝐏𝐨𝐥𝐲𝐦𝐨𝐫𝐩𝐡𝐢𝐬𝐦 ✅ Occurs when a parent class reference is used to call an overridden method in the child class✅ Example: Run-Time Polymorphism (via Method Over-riding) java𝒄𝒍𝒂𝒔𝒔 𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 { 𝒗𝒐𝒊𝒅 𝒂𝒖𝒕𝒉𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒊𝒄𝒂𝒕𝒆() { 𝑺𝒚𝒔𝒕𝒆𝒎.𝒐𝒖𝒕.𝒑𝒓𝒊𝒏𝒕𝒍𝒏("𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 𝒂𝒔 𝑮𝒖𝒆𝒔𝒕"); }}𝒄𝒍𝒂𝒔𝒔 𝑨𝒅𝒎𝒊𝒏𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 𝒆𝒙𝒕𝒆𝒏𝒅𝒔 𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 { 𝒗𝒐𝒊𝒅 𝒂𝒖𝒕𝒉𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒊𝒄𝒂𝒕𝒆() { 𝑺𝒚𝒔𝒕𝒆𝒎.𝒐𝒖𝒕.𝒑𝒓𝒊𝒏𝒕𝒍𝒏("𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 𝒂𝒔 𝑨𝒅𝒎𝒊𝒏"); }}𝒑𝒖𝒃𝒍𝒊𝒄 𝒄𝒍𝒂𝒔𝒔 𝑻𝒆𝒔𝒕 { 𝒑𝒖𝒃𝒍𝒊𝒄 𝒔𝒕𝒂𝒕𝒊𝒄 𝒗𝒐𝒊𝒅 𝒎𝒂𝒊𝒏(𝑺𝒕𝒓𝒊𝒏𝒈[] 𝒂𝒓𝒈𝒔) { 𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 𝒐𝒃𝒋 = 𝒏𝒆𝒘 𝑨𝒅𝒎𝒊𝒏𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏(); // 👈 𝑹𝒆𝒇𝒆𝒓𝒆𝒏𝒄𝒆 𝒕𝒚𝒑𝒆: 𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 | 𝑶𝒃𝒋𝒆𝒄𝒕 𝒕𝒚𝒑𝒆:𝑨𝒅𝒎𝒊𝒏𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 𝒐𝒃𝒋.𝒂𝒖𝒕𝒉𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒊𝒄𝒂𝒕𝒆(); // 👈 𝑪𝒂𝒍𝒍𝒔 𝑨𝒅𝒎𝒊𝒏𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏’𝒔 𝒎𝒆𝒕𝒉𝒐𝒅 𝒂𝒕 𝒓𝒖𝒏𝒕𝒊𝒎𝒆(𝒅𝒚𝒏𝒂𝒎𝒊𝒄 𝒃𝒊𝒏𝒅𝒊𝒏𝒈) }}

HOW REMOTE WORK GIVES SMALL BUSINESSES A FIGHTING CHANCE In early 2020 as we contemplated or more like dreaded the idea of having the entire team working remotely, little did we know that remote work would be the silver lining we needed.Sure, we moved on from NGcareers in 2020 (after exiting to ROAM/Jobberman) but the lessons we got from working remotely in 2020 positioned us for our next venture.When we started Remote4Africa there was no question of whether to be a remote company or not. The very nature of Remote4Africa meant we had to live what we preached - full remote operation.SO HOW DOES WORKING REMOTELY FAVOUR THE SMALL GUY? As a small, medium or growing company remote work gives you several advantages. Forget the naysayers and come with me. The two biggest advantages;Bigger Talent Pool As a remote company you are not restricted to just one city in your search for talent to help grow the company. You can literally hire smart young people from across the entire country or even continent (We help companies hire remotely - https://lnkd.in/g5-2qm2p). Your talent pool becomes automatically wider. Greater Cost EfficiencyA startup or small business usually doesn’t have endless money, in fact most struggle financially in the early years until their products/services start to generate significant revenue to outpace expenses. So how do you keep yourself in the game and extend the chances of your business surviving? By keeping expenses as low as possible. Going remote does that for you. We spent millions annually in office rent in Lagos. That was money that could have gone into marketing or direct revenue impacting activity. If you are building/growing a business in any major African city you know office costs are a significant part of your expenses. Aside rent you are talking about utilities, furniture etc.You can take some of that saving and give your remote staff stuff like data allowances, workspace allowances etc to help them set up and work comfortably from home.If you run a company/business and thinking of going remote you can reach out and ask any questions. I’ll be glad to advise and share lessons from what we’ve learnt running a remote company for 5 years now.hashtag#hiringremote hashtag#remotecompanies hashtag#businesstips hashtag#recruitingtips

Day:-8 Learning selenium with java (Automation)✅"Before diving into Selenium with Java, it's important to have a good understanding of Core Java topics."🌟 What is Exception Handling?Exception handling is a way to manage errors that occur while a program is running. Instead of stopping the entire program when an error happens, exception handling lets you control what should happen when something goes wrong.🌟 Why is it important?It helps prevent the program from crashing.It allows the program to continue running even after an error.It shows clear and friendly error messages to the user.It makes debugging and fixing issues easier.🌟 How does it work?You write the code that might cause an error inside a special block. If an error happens, another block will handle it. This keeps the program safe and avoids unexpected crashes.🌟 Key Terms:Try: The block where you write the code that might cause an error.Catch: The block where you handle the error if it occurs.Finally: A block that runs no matter what—whether there was an error or not.Throw: Used to create custom errors or exceptions.Throws: Used to declare exceptions that a method might cause.

Today's Learning Journey 📕: Stacks in JavaToday, I explored one of the fundamental data structures— the Stack.**What is a Stack?** A Stack is a linear data structure that follows the LIFO (Last In, First Out) principle. The last element added is the first one to be removed. Think of it like a stack of plates — you add to the top and remove from the top.**Why It's Important?** Stacks are used in many areas like function calls, expression evaluation, undo features in editors, and more. Understanding how they work is essential for solving real-world problems and mastering algorithms.**Key Takeaways:** 1. Core Operations: push(), pop(), peek(), and isEmpty()2. Implementation: Explored Java's built-in Stack class and also implemented it manually using arrays and linked lists. 3. Applications: Helps build intuition for recursion, backtracking, and parsing tasks.hashtag#Java hashtag#DataStructures hashtag#Stack hashtag#CodingJourney hashtag#Programming hashtag#TechLearning

كلامنا النهاردة عن  JVM، JRE، وJDK... مين هم أبطال القصة؟في عالم جافا، عندنا 3 شخصيات رئيسية، وكل واحدة ليها دور مهم جدًا:يلا نغوص سوا في عالم JVM، JRE، وJDK ونفهم كل واحدة فيهم بتشتغل إزاي؟ 🧠 أولاً: JVM – Java Virtual Machine ده هو قلب القصة.تخيله كأنه "المترجم الذكي" اللي بياخد الـ Bytecode (ملفات .class) ويحوّله لحاجة الجهاز يفهمها وظيفته:يقرأ ملفات .class اللي بيطلّعها الـ Compilerيفسرها سطر بسطر ويحوّلها لـ Machine Codeيتعامل مع نظام التشغيل (Windows / Linux / macOS)بيشتغل على أي جهاز فيه JVM → عشان كده جافا بتشتغل في كل مكان!أنواعه: كل نظام تشغيل ليه JVM خاصة بيه. الكود بيشتغل على أي نظام بشرط يكون فيه JVM.🌱 ثانيًا: JRE – Java Runtime Environment📦 دي البيئة اللي بيعيش فيها برنامج جافا بعد ما تكتبه.بتتكوّن من:JVMJava Class Libraries (زي System.out, ArrayList, Scanner, …)وظيفتها: تشغّل برامج جافا الجاهزة، بس مش ينفع تكتبي أو ترجمي كود جديد بيها. مثال: لو عندك برنامج جاهز وعايزة تشغّليه → محتاجة JRE فقط.🔧 ثالثًا: JDK – Java Development Kitدي العُدّة الكاملة لأي مطوّر/مطوّرة جافا.بتحتوي على:✅ كل مكونات الـ JRE✅ أدوات التطوير (Dev Tools):javac: لتحويل الكود لـ Bytecodejava: لتشغيل البرامجjavadoc: لتوليد التوثيقDebuggers: لتتبع الأخطاءوظيفتها:كتابة الكودترجمتهتشغيلهاختباره يعني باختصار: لو هتشتغل على مشروع جافا → لازم تنزّل الـ JDK الـ JRE لوحده مش هيكفي.لو وصلت لحد هنا، شاركني: أنت كنت عارف الفرق بينهم قبل كده؟ ولا دي أول مرة الصورة توضح؟ 😊👇hashtag#Java hashtag#JVM hashtag#JRE hashtag#JDK hashtag#LearnJava hashtag#Backend hashtag#ProgrammingBasics hashtag#لينكدإن

In Java, the final keyword is used to restrict the modification of variables, methods, and classes. There are 3 ways to input in the final keyword.. 3 ways to constext -:-->Final Variable-:A final variable cannot be reassigned after it has been initialized.For objects, final means the reference cannot change, but the object's contents can (unless the object itself is immutable).-->Final Method-:A final method cannot be overridden by subclasses.-->Final Class-:A final class cannot be extended (no subclassing).hashtag#Java hashtag#Coding hashtag#Learning hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment hashtag#Programming hashtag#TechJourney

Day:-8 Learning selenium with java (Automation)✅"Before diving into Selenium with Java, it's important to have a good understanding of Core Java topics."🌟 What is a Package?A package is like a folder in your computer that helps you organize your Java files (classes, interfaces, etc.).🌟 Why do we use Packages?To organize code neatlyTo avoid name conflicts (two classes can have the same name if they are in different packages)To reuse code easilyTo make project structure clean and easy to manage🌟 Types of Packages:Built-in packages – already available in Java (like java.util, java.io)User-defined packages – created by us to group our own classes🌟 How to Create and Use a Package?You create a package using the package keyword.You use it by importing it with the import keyword.🌟 Think of it like this:Your computer has folders (packages)Inside folders, you have files (Java classes)You can open and use files from any folder using the correct path (importing the package)

🔁 𝐌𝐞𝐭𝐡𝐨𝐝 𝐎𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐫𝐢𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠, 𝐃𝐲𝐧𝐚𝐦𝐢𝐜 𝐁𝐢𝐧𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠 & 𝐑𝐮𝐧𝐭𝐢𝐦𝐞 𝐏𝐨𝐥𝐲𝐦𝐨𝐫𝐩𝐡𝐢𝐬𝐦 — 𝐒𝐢𝐦𝐩𝐥𝐢𝐟𝐢𝐞𝐝!If you're working with inheritance in Java or automation frameworks like Selenium, this is one of the most powerful concepts👇🔁 𝐌𝐞𝐭𝐡𝐨𝐝 𝐎𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐫𝐢𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠 ✅ Definition: Redefining a method of the parent class in the child class🔹 Key Rules:1. Method signature must be exactly the same2. Return type must be the same or covariant3. Access modifier can be more permissive (not more restrictive)4. Happens only in inheritance5. Enables runtime polymorphism⚡ 𝐃𝐲𝐧𝐚𝐦𝐢𝐜 𝐁𝐢𝐧𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠 (𝐚.𝐤.𝐚 𝐋𝐚𝐭𝐞 𝐁𝐢𝐧𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠) ✅ The method to execute is decided at runtime 🔹 Used when:1. You're overriding methods2. Based on object type, not the reference type📌 | 𝐉𝐚𝐯𝐚 𝐝𝐞𝐭𝐞𝐫𝐦𝐢𝐧𝐞𝐬 𝐚𝐭 𝐫𝐮𝐧𝐭𝐢𝐦𝐞 𝐰𝐡𝐢𝐜𝐡 𝐨𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐫𝐢𝐝𝐝𝐞𝐧 𝐦𝐞𝐭𝐡𝐨𝐝 𝐭𝐨 𝐞𝐱𝐞𝐜𝐮𝐭𝐞 𝐛𝐚𝐬𝐞𝐝 𝐨𝐧 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐨𝐛𝐣𝐞𝐜𝐭 𝐭𝐲𝐩𝐞🛠️ 𝐑𝐮𝐧𝐭𝐢𝐦𝐞 𝐏𝐨𝐥𝐲𝐦𝐨𝐫𝐩𝐡𝐢𝐬𝐦 ✅ Occurs when a parent class reference is used to call an overridden method in the child class✅ Example: Run-Time Polymorphism (via Method Over-riding) java𝒄𝒍𝒂𝒔𝒔 𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 { 𝒗𝒐𝒊𝒅 𝒂𝒖𝒕𝒉𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒊𝒄𝒂𝒕𝒆() { 𝑺𝒚𝒔𝒕𝒆𝒎.𝒐𝒖𝒕.𝒑𝒓𝒊𝒏𝒕𝒍𝒏("𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 𝒂𝒔 𝑮𝒖𝒆𝒔𝒕"); }}𝒄𝒍𝒂𝒔𝒔 𝑨𝒅𝒎𝒊𝒏𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 𝒆𝒙𝒕𝒆𝒏𝒅𝒔 𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 { 𝒗𝒐𝒊𝒅 𝒂𝒖𝒕𝒉𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒊𝒄𝒂𝒕𝒆() { 𝑺𝒚𝒔𝒕𝒆𝒎.𝒐𝒖𝒕.𝒑𝒓𝒊𝒏𝒕𝒍𝒏("𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 𝒂𝒔 𝑨𝒅𝒎𝒊𝒏"); }}𝒑𝒖𝒃𝒍𝒊𝒄 𝒄𝒍𝒂𝒔𝒔 𝑻𝒆𝒔𝒕 { 𝒑𝒖𝒃𝒍𝒊𝒄 𝒔𝒕𝒂𝒕𝒊𝒄 𝒗𝒐𝒊𝒅 𝒎𝒂𝒊𝒏(𝑺𝒕𝒓𝒊𝒏𝒈[] 𝒂𝒓𝒈𝒔) { 𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 𝒐𝒃𝒋 = 𝒏𝒆𝒘 𝑨𝒅𝒎𝒊𝒏𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏(); // 👈 𝑹𝒆𝒇𝒆𝒓𝒆𝒏𝒄𝒆 𝒕𝒚𝒑𝒆: 𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 | 𝑶𝒃𝒋𝒆𝒄𝒕 𝒕𝒚𝒑𝒆:𝑨𝒅𝒎𝒊𝒏𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏 𝒐𝒃𝒋.𝒂𝒖𝒕𝒉𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒊𝒄𝒂𝒕𝒆(); // 👈 𝑪𝒂𝒍𝒍𝒔 𝑨𝒅𝒎𝒊𝒏𝑳𝒐𝒈𝒊𝒏’𝒔 𝒎𝒆𝒕𝒉𝒐𝒅 𝒂𝒕 𝒓𝒖𝒏𝒕𝒊𝒎𝒆(𝒅𝒚𝒏𝒂𝒎𝒊𝒄 𝒃𝒊𝒏𝒅𝒊𝒏𝒈) }}

HOW REMOTE WORK GIVES SMALL BUSINESSES A FIGHTING CHANCE In early 2020 as we contemplated or more like dreaded the idea of having the entire team working remotely, little did we know that remote work would be the silver lining we needed.Sure, we moved on from NGcareers in 2020 (after exiting to ROAM/Jobberman) but the lessons we got from working remotely in 2020 positioned us for our next venture.When we started Remote4Africa there was no question of whether to be a remote company or not. The very nature of Remote4Africa meant we had to live what we preached - full remote operation.SO HOW DOES WORKING REMOTELY FAVOUR THE SMALL GUY? As a small, medium or growing company remote work gives you several advantages. Forget the naysayers and come with me. The two biggest advantages;Bigger Talent Pool As a remote company you are not restricted to just one city in your search for talent to help grow the company. You can literally hire smart young people from across the entire country or even continent (We help companies hire remotely - https://lnkd.in/g5-2qm2p). Your talent pool becomes automatically wider. Greater Cost EfficiencyA startup or small business usually doesn’t have endless money, in fact most struggle financially in the early years until their products/services start to generate significant revenue to outpace expenses. So how do you keep yourself in the game and extend the chances of your business surviving? By keeping expenses as low as possible. Going remote does that for you. We spent millions annually in office rent in Lagos. That was money that could have gone into marketing or direct revenue impacting activity. If you are building/growing a business in any major African city you know office costs are a significant part of your expenses. Aside rent you are talking about utilities, furniture etc.You can take some of that saving and give your remote staff stuff like data allowances, workspace allowances etc to help them set up and work comfortably from home.If you run a company/business and thinking of going remote you can reach out and ask any questions. I’ll be glad to advise and share lessons from what we’ve learnt running a remote company for 5 years now.hashtag#hiringremote hashtag#remotecompanies hashtag#businesstips hashtag#recruitingtips

Day:-8 Learning selenium with java (Automation)✅"Before diving into Selenium with Java, it's important to have a good understanding of Core Java topics."🌟 What is Exception Handling?Exception handling is a way to manage errors that occur while a program is running. Instead of stopping the entire program when an error happens, exception handling lets you control what should happen when something goes wrong.🌟 Why is it important?It helps prevent the program from crashing.It allows the program to continue running even after an error.It shows clear and friendly error messages to the user.It makes debugging and fixing issues easier.🌟 How does it work?You write the code that might cause an error inside a special block. If an error happens, another block will handle it. This keeps the program safe and avoids unexpected crashes.🌟 Key Terms:Try: The block where you write the code that might cause an error.Catch: The block where you handle the error if it occurs.Finally: A block that runs no matter what—whether there was an error or not.Throw: Used to create custom errors or exceptions.Throws: Used to declare exceptions that a method might cause.

Today's Learning Journey 📕: Stacks in JavaToday, I explored one of the fundamental data structures— the Stack.**What is a Stack?** A Stack is a linear data structure that follows the LIFO (Last In, First Out) principle. The last element added is the first one to be removed. Think of it like a stack of plates — you add to the top and remove from the top.**Why It's Important?** Stacks are used in many areas like function calls, expression evaluation, undo features in editors, and more. Understanding how they work is essential for solving real-world problems and mastering algorithms.**Key Takeaways:** 1. Core Operations: push(), pop(), peek(), and isEmpty()2. Implementation: Explored Java's built-in Stack class and also implemented it manually using arrays and linked lists. 3. Applications: Helps build intuition for recursion, backtracking, and parsing tasks.hashtag#Java hashtag#DataStructures hashtag#Stack hashtag#CodingJourney hashtag#Programming hashtag#TechLearning

كلامنا النهاردة عن  JVM، JRE، وJDK... مين هم أبطال القصة؟في عالم جافا، عندنا 3 شخصيات رئيسية، وكل واحدة ليها دور مهم جدًا:يلا نغوص سوا في عالم JVM، JRE، وJDK ونفهم كل واحدة فيهم بتشتغل إزاي؟ 🧠 أولاً: JVM – Java Virtual Machine ده هو قلب القصة.تخيله كأنه "المترجم الذكي" اللي بياخد الـ Bytecode (ملفات .class) ويحوّله لحاجة الجهاز يفهمها وظيفته:يقرأ ملفات .class اللي بيطلّعها الـ Compilerيفسرها سطر بسطر ويحوّلها لـ Machine Codeيتعامل مع نظام التشغيل (Windows / Linux / macOS)بيشتغل على أي جهاز فيه JVM → عشان كده جافا بتشتغل في كل مكان!أنواعه: كل نظام تشغيل ليه JVM خاصة بيه. الكود بيشتغل على أي نظام بشرط يكون فيه JVM.🌱 ثانيًا: JRE – Java Runtime Environment📦 دي البيئة اللي بيعيش فيها برنامج جافا بعد ما تكتبه.بتتكوّن من:JVMJava Class Libraries (زي System.out, ArrayList, Scanner, …)وظيفتها: تشغّل برامج جافا الجاهزة، بس مش ينفع تكتبي أو ترجمي كود جديد بيها. مثال: لو عندك برنامج جاهز وعايزة تشغّليه → محتاجة JRE فقط.🔧 ثالثًا: JDK – Java Development Kitدي العُدّة الكاملة لأي مطوّر/مطوّرة جافا.بتحتوي على:✅ كل مكونات الـ JRE✅ أدوات التطوير (Dev Tools):javac: لتحويل الكود لـ Bytecodejava: لتشغيل البرامجjavadoc: لتوليد التوثيقDebuggers: لتتبع الأخطاءوظيفتها:كتابة الكودترجمتهتشغيلهاختباره يعني باختصار: لو هتشتغل على مشروع جافا → لازم تنزّل الـ JDK الـ JRE لوحده مش هيكفي.لو وصلت لحد هنا، شاركني: أنت كنت عارف الفرق بينهم قبل كده؟ ولا دي أول مرة الصورة توضح؟ 😊👇hashtag#Java hashtag#JVM hashtag#JRE hashtag#JDK hashtag#LearnJava hashtag#Backend hashtag#ProgrammingBasics hashtag#لينكدإن
